Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Telekinesys
Reviews.Content: Absolutely adore this hotel, and have been staying here for many years. Before the refurbishment, it was fantastic. Actually stayed there while the building works were going on, but since its completion the bar has been given an even bigger "boost" and has a new feel to it which really works. Bear in mind this is one of the livelier nightspots in town at the weekend, so don't be surprised to find the hotel lobby full of people having fun as you return on a Saturday night! The cool corner rooms are excellent value, and the furnishings are superbly in tune with the Californian vibe. Whenever I've asked for something special from the hotel, it's NEVER been too much to ask and they're some of the friendliest staff I've ever encountered - before, during and after your stay. Check out the 3D map behind the check-in desks too. I want one!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice bar”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: Just a shame staff at the bar was so incredibly rude, no service oriented at all. I spent there 5 nights and unfortunately cannot say anything positive about them. As for the rest it is fantastic, beautiful view, beautiful room, the most complete mini bar I have ever seen and in contrast to the staff at the bar, reception was incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAY; Very Customer Service Oriented”
Reviews.Author: RJ263
Reviews.Content: My stay was FABULOUS at the W Hotel in San Francisco!!!!!! I was greeted with TOP NOTCH FIRST CLASS SERVICE. 1) Before I could get out of the taxi cab, someone was there to take my bags. 2) The Front Desk Rep checked me into my room promptly. I was wondering if my previous request to change my room from a double bed to a king size one would be honored. Guess what? I did not have to Wonder or Ask. I was placed in a King Size Deluxe Room on the 29th floor. The room was very CLASSY; contemporary, beautiful, accommodating and relaxing.....my kind of style for sure!!! 3) Before I could walk away from the Front Desk a gentleman with a GREAT PLEASANT smile greeted us with 2 tickets for free cocktails at the Bar. WOW!!!! UNBELIEVABLE!!!! 4) Concierge was very informational regarding entertainment, food and transportation. We used the complimentary ACURA service; this was very thoughtful. We were able to save money spent on a taxi, and used the money instead to give the Acura driver a BIG TIP!!! I'm in the market for a car. The W may have sold me on buying an ACURA. The marketing strategy worked. 4) Oh, YES!!! I loved the Trace Restaurant. The breakfast and dinner were SUPERB!!!! Happy Hour at the BAR was the BUM!!! The room decor and ambiance was just so appropriate. My partner almost missed his flight because we were having such a great time. 5) Overall, my words cannot express how much I loved staying at the W Hotel. My stay was short, but the next time I will plan to stay longer. This was a very romantic trip for my partner and I. We fell in love again and again and again (smile).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: gabyghin
Reviews.Content: Great location. Check in was a breeze. Room was excellent. Fabulous desk and corner sitting area. Great bed.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home in SF”
Reviews.Author: Steven W
Reviews.Content: When I go to San Francisco I have certain expectations. I expect to meet interesting people, I expect to hear new music, I expect to eat great food, I expect to have a lot of fun. Staying at the W is always critical to this experience. The edgy bar, staff, and scene immediately plug me into whats going on, while the fantastic rooms and service allow me to decompress after a big night out. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Go party at The W”
Reviews.Author: joepublic14
Reviews.Content: The W in downtown San Francisco is awesome. On-the-ball staff (although some can appear quite aloof to us Brits), amazing facilities including the 'Whatever, Whenever' 121 concierge service which puts UK hotels to shame. The service includes a personal, follow-up 'How did we do?' call to your room which was brilliant although I felt it was sometimes a tad over-the-top when you may have simply ordered room service. Overall, W is great for the short-stay business traveller. On the flipside, W turns into a party hotel at night which, although energising, is quite hard to get away from if you just require a quiet evening by the bar. However,on the upside, Bliss spa, on the fourth floor provides a welcome haven albeit limited in terms of opening hours. If only it was open earlier in the morning and later on in the evening, the spa would have enjoyed more of bookings from me. Also watch out if you purchase any of the products from Bliss as some of the pump-action packaging is faulty which causes unecessary stress after what should be a calm experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Incredible
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great - it has the funky W design and vibe that W is known for. Great bathroom products, great view over San Fran from the window, great service, great bar downstairs that was more like a nightclub when I came in at 1am one night. The fun vibe and quirky additions in the room make this such a good place. I like how the same music from the bar plays consistently throughout the whole hotel. Beds are amazing - there were 5 of us who all stayed and everyone commented on their comfort - almost missed our flight to Vegas having such a good sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Funky... but full of geeks”
Reviews.Author: Chr1sJ0n3s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights while the Games Developers Conference was on. Have never seen so many socially inept young men drinking beer while avoiding eye contact with everyone else in the room. Strangely funny. Great hotel. True to the W format, everything is minimalist with high tech lighting and excellently finished. Excellent staff and great facilities, although the walls aren't very think and noise can travel between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLEEPYCAT
Reviews.Content: Ended up with a room on the 20th Floor. Gorgeous view, clean, quite - everything you can ask for. No negetives that I can think of. Good location, not in the middle of busy "touristy" stuff, and that worked for us. Would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ongoing remodel is loud, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Terence F
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to be given an upper floor room on the 30th floor. Unfortunetly the room above mine was being remodeled and the very loud construction noises of removing the bathroom tiles and having them crash on the floor above my room prevented me from sleeping past 9am. Why they put anyone so close to one of the construction rooms I have no idea! I Travel often and stayed in many hotels where rooms were being renovated, but I have never experienced this volume of noise! I find it more then unexceptable that any guest would be placed so close to that construction noise. When I complained I was "upgraded" to a corner room on the 24th floor. I still had to pack everything up in my room and drag it o a new room. The night prior I had blood stains on the sheets about 1 inch below the bottom of the pillow.. If the maid missed it, she was blind. She also didn't restock my shampoos and conditioners for 2 nights in a row. My first room and my second room both had stray hairs in very visible locations in the bathrooms. I would say the maids have miss interpreted the "whatever" slogan incorrectly! The correct responses were given when I complained about the blood stains on the bedding, having run out of shampoo and conditioner, and when I was awoken from the very loud construction. "I'm very sorry," seems to have replaced the, "Whatever, Whenever". I expect the hotel will offer their apologies and say they are sorry once again, but I am just, I'm sorry'ed out.

Reviews.Title: “Small but stylish, great service”
Reviews.Author: tesseract68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 4 nights on business. It was part of a group discount so the rate was much lower than normal. The W is conveniently located to the convention center and other hotels, so it is ideally situated if you are here for a meeting. It is also close to BART and MUNI so you can get around the city very easily. Also, there are lots of restaurants and shops very close by. Yes, the rooms and lobby are not as vast and expansive as other hotels, but if you are willing to look past that, the rooms are quite comfortable. As mentioned in the other reviews, the decor is chic/modern--this is obviously not a hit with everyone. However, I thought it was a nice change of pace compared to your typical bland colonial hotel room, though it did get a little over the top sometimes, like the keywords that are used to label the kaleidoscope and the color changing Buddha (not kidding, they're in the rooms!). There are all sorts of little perks in the room (most not free!). The built-in desk is great for working on your laptop, with a great office chair and two charging stations, and there's an ipod dock and foot massage mat. The beds are very comfortable. Because the hotel is relatively new, everything is very clean. One thing that is unusual is that there are lots of things in the room that can be used for a charge--much more than other hotels. For example, they have a liquor cabinet (full size bottles), snack cabinet, and other things like shopping bag, bottle of wine, bottled water, that will incur a charge (the fee is always prominently displayed, which is good). So, if you are good at ignoring these things, it's not much of an issue. Also, internet access is not free. Use of the gym is free, and it was nice and well equipped. My interactions with the staff were very positive--everyone was very helpful, and check-in/out was very efficient. I was early for check-in but they were able to put me in a room all the same, which I greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “W San Francisco Rocks!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliGuy303
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at W San Francisco for the first time last weekend, and I was completely blown away by the service and beauty of the hotel. Check-in was a breeze; Nadia at the welcome desk was super cute and hospitable. I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: Stylish and cool bar downstairs, usual good service from a W hotel upstairs -- enjoyed much and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Burrr”
Reviews.Author: nayal b
Reviews.Content: When we were in San Fran it was freezing we stayed at the w not bad but I stayed in the biggest room it was not that nice very small but quaint but their French toast and hot chocolate is amazing! Service was average

Reviews.Title: “W - Way ahead of some of its rivals.”
Reviews.Author: AndyFWimbledon
Reviews.Content: W stands for Whatever / Whenever, and they really do !, from organising Dry cleaning (as my suit had developed creases on creases ), to a coffee making facility provided inside 5 minutes of asking, to room service to bar service. Room Stylish and immaculate, large size room on the 29th floor. Perfectly turned down every day, Stayed for business and could have stayed longer. Funky friendly bar, perfiect for eating at rather than siting in a restautrant on your own, not the cheapest, but they are offering a premium service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Standard excellent W service”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for 2 nights. Have stayed at several W properties around the country. As usual - EXCELLENT service and as always - funky decor (make sure you turn off the glowing budha in your room before turning in for the night). I would recommend asking for a room on a higher floor (which I had). The street noise can be loud at times (there is a fire station next door). It is close to the Mascone center and the financial district. Not a lot of local charm in the area (it is the business district after all) but it is a quick cab ride to anywhere you need to go in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew520
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. Most recent stay was for a professional meeting. I called from Chicago to let them know that I was going to be arriving late and was told that it would not be a problem. When I arrived at 11:30 pm there was no room because they had overbooked a number of guests. They immediately offered to send me to the Meridien. I specifically stayed at the W because it is across the street from the Convention Center and I had 6AM meetings. Although the Meridien is very nice (actually better rooms than the W) it was inconvenient. I was moved back to the W and given a breakfast and drink coupon. Overall they handled the situation poorly. The rest of my stay was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Fishbaby1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my brief stay. The hotel was very centrally located. The service was fantastic and the food was really good too. Nice change of pace from the standard hotel chains!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Fun, Totally W”
Reviews.Author: soberesident
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at W Hotels and the San Francisco location met our expectations. The view from our generously sized room was beautiful. The furnishings were comfortable and stylish. We had lunch in the Living Room restaurant which was very good and reasonably priced for an upscale city hotel. The spa did a nice job on a quicky manicure. The valet parking is pricey, but no worse than other similar locations. All in all a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicholask71
Reviews.Content: A very cool and trendy hotel with a great vibe and excellent service being provide at all times - I simply loved this hotel and it will now be my default option when travelling to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: c h
Reviews.Content: I'm not even compare this W hotel with all the other W hotels I've stayed at before. This hotel is the worst among all the hotels I've stayed at. Service was ridiculously slow, it took them almost 40 minutes to bring two pairs of slippers to our room. The directions for breakfast was not clear at all. They "invited" us to have breakfast at the restaurant for time slot between 9:15 to 10:00 and then they say it's not complimentary. The staffs were nice but the manager was arrogant. I was absolutely disappointed and they totally ruined the W hotel brand!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond service”
Reviews.Author: Hilary H
Reviews.Content: Would just like to thank W hotel (particularly Julie.M and Gordon.K) for their incredibly friendly and diligent service. They were able to execute a personalised surprise for my partner in under 24hrs. I highly recommend the W hotel and I'm sure you'll be delighted with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: anoulia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at W san francisco. Very nice hotel in SoMa, walking distance to Union Square. Rooms were nice. The staff was mostly non-caring and aloof. Otherwise this is a good choice for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: edward o
Reviews.Content: The W should be your choice especially if you are under 30. If over, it might be a bit too trendy and "hipster" for you. For ex. entering the hotel you have to walk through the lounge. On a Sat nite it was a crowded and happening techno lounge with blaring music, with the booking desks right next door. Strange set up. Rooms are nice and very comfy however, if a bit small. Nice smallish pool and hot tub but the area does not absorb more than 3 people well. Great location, right next to San Francisco Musuem of Modern Art and a block or two from San Francisco Center and Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanChicago_Il
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W now. Have been here multiple times and it's always a great stay. One of the best experiences as a Platinum. Always a great room, great service and welcome gifts. Great location as well, easy walk to many places. Definitely a favorite

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CopanoJoe
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed at a W, there are not a lot of surprises here. However, the rooms had lighter colors than some Ws making the guest rooms seem a bit brighter Ws which was nice. Also, (with the exception of one bartender) the staff at this hotel was noticeably better than at the average W. The hotel has the W beds which are great. The bars on the first and second floor were very busy on the weekend with lots of nonhotel guests. The hotel also provides the Acura experience car service in the evening which is nice and was easy to book. Guests should note that because of the sliding doors involved the bathrooms in the guest rooms do not provide much privacy. The hotel is in a fairly convenient location for sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Corrupt doorman tarnished an otherwise AMAZING stay!”
Reviews.Author: FDMARIA
Reviews.Content: The Asian inspired decor and W signature traits make this a great hotel to stay at. My only complaint was the actions of a particular doorman(he has red hair and an extensive beard) on the morning of March 6th. I was attempting to get a cab right next to the entrance but the cab driver was asking me to go to another cab behind him(as is standard). When I explained to the cabbie that there was no cab driver and he would need to take me...the DOORMAN OF THE W(who clearly saw me approach the cab door to open it)...opened the trunk and started to place another guest's luggage. The cab driver got out and helped the two other guests in the cab and they all pretended I didn't exist. I saw the cab give the doorman something...at that point...I got into the next cab that was parked...the driver had returned and had been watching. He said "you wasted your time with that Russian cab driver....he is partners with the doorman and gives him 5 dollars for every airport fair the doorman gives him". I was a guest at the hotel but because I was dressed casually and didn't have luggage...I was discriminated. I could have been a meeting planner for a conference there and this attitude from the doorman would have influenced my decision to ever hold a conference at that hotel....shame on him.

Reviews.Title: “This is how to enjoy SF”
Reviews.Author: irieisle
Reviews.Content: Very swanky San Fran vibe. It's a pleasure to stay in any W hotel and this property doesn't disappoint. Was upgraded since I'm a Plat SPG member and had a great jr suite. You enter the hotel and there's lots if energy with their restauarnt and bar in the evening. When enterin your room, you are welcomed with a very fresh smelling room (one of their signature scents) and have all amenities you can think of. I would highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: ncoutroulis
Reviews.Content: Not as good as some of their other properties, but in keeping with the W brand, the hotel is cool, hip, modern, etc. The room, the superior king, was small, but had a nice view to the bay. The staff is great, and really the only disappointment was the gym. Very small and if you're looking for anything more than a treadmill, you'll be pretty, well, disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: coolguy2098
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to SF. I was there for a week of meetings. This is one of my favorite hotels. I love to sit by the window in my room an look out at the city. It’s the perfect spot to read a good book. The restaurant in the hotel, TRACE, is great too. I think it just changed. I had a really good chicken dish for dinner there. A definite must try! Also the rooms service club sandwich and grilled chicken sandwich are great late night dinner options too. If you happen to be there on Saturday walk to the Farmers Market for a porchetta sandwich with rosemary potatoes. ( high cholesterol but worth every bite). Oh yea, great coffee there too! The location of the hotel is ideal for walking to just about anywhere in the downtwon area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service in SF”
Reviews.Author: Valski14
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at the W Hotel in SF. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, the hotel clean and trendy and the food in the restaurant is perhaps the best in all of SF. I can't say enough good things!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and hip in downtown San Francico”
Reviews.Author: katrina50
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms and excellent service. Loved the bliss beauty products and the Buda statue that glowed a cool pink. It is a good location and has a hip bar. I definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “My day in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: theefroggster
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this W Hotel, but it felt like I had been there before. The staff were both professional and friendly and met any request I had with enthisiasm. The location for me was excellent. My room was perfect, clean and comfortable with everything I need, except a coffee maker, which was brought up promptly when I requested one...followed by a call from the Whatever/Whenever folks to be sure I received it. I couldn't have asked for better service or better people. I am happy to recommend this hotel for your trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaMichele
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the weekend (President's Day weekend) and had an a great time. We stayed in a Corner Room on the 17th floor. I honestly did not want to leave! Pro's: -awesome decor through out the hotel and room. Loved the little details in the room that made it seem more like a home than a hotel. -hotel is always playing great music -superrrrr comfy bed! -clean! Everything smelled nice! I hate when towels, sheets, the room etc at hotels have a funky smell. Even the elevators had floral scented air fresheners -upbeat and young vibe. -great hotel bar but a little pricey -room was pretty quiet. I hate being woken up by hallway noise! -loved the Bliss Spa products -Close to Union Square Con's: -PARKING! Parking at the hotel is over $50 a day. TIP: Park at the Moscone Center Parking Garage. Literally just a few steps away from the hotel and half the price. $27 per day. I left my car there the whole weekend with no problem at all. -A bit pricey. -Shower pressure was low in our room. Not a big deal but slightly annoying. - The dinner menu at TRACE didn't appeal to me or boyfriend who are total foodies so we decided not to dine there even though we wanted to. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. W has got me hooked. I'll definitely be looking into their other locations for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: kbc88
Reviews.Content: My husband, sixteen year old daughter and I have just returned from a 4-day stay at the W in San Francisco. My first overall impression was that the decor was somewhat "dated". These days "hip" is bright, sleek and cool with lots of clean lines, and light stone floors/walls. Instead the decor at the W was dark and more 1990's black with hits of primary colours. Certainly not what I expected for a trendy hotel, but certainly not a deal breaker either. Decor aside, the check-in was fast and efficient. The decor of the rooms was much nicer and brighter. However, I was disappointed by the size of the beds. I have stayed at other Westins in the past and have always looked forward to their "heavenly" beds. This time the bed, which felt a tad smaller than a double, was far too small for two adults and my husband and I both woke up with knots in our backs. As well, the walls between the rooms were quite thin as I could hear the conversations of my neighbours as well as their music quite clearly. Fortunately, they went to bed around 1 am so I did not complain to the front desk. The fitness room is quite well equipped and the pool is a nice size. Overall, our stay was adequate but I would try a different hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco CoooL”
Reviews.Author: mbmuscle
Reviews.Content: I had an evening check-in & was greeted by an energetic W staff, smooth check in in a spacious upscale lobby, with subtle groovy tunes in the background. The valet & bell staff was superb. The renovation is spectacular, common areas have the cool W vibe and allow for work to be done without being disturbed, even wi-fi is powerful. Sleeping rooms have an elegant Asian accent, quiet from street noise. I will stay here on my next visit to SF, Cali!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bus1
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides what you'd expect from a W, a bustling lobby with a trendy theme, and smaller guestrooms. As a business traveler, I would have liked a larger room (the corner rooms had more space) and better lighting around the desk. Otherwise, it's a fun hotel to stay at if you're visiting San Francisco. It's blocks away from Market St., walking distance to many restaurants, though a bit further from the touristy Pier 39. The service at the hotel was good, and the gym was decent, although not very large. I stayed at this hotel several times over a two month span, and found that while some of the appointments in the room felt like cheap IKEA materials, it was always clean, which is always important.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seattle2sf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend on an overnight getaway to the city. We live 20 minutes away from San Francisco and had reservations to Benu restaurant, which was a block away. I wanted to stay at a Starwood property in SF since I'm a Preferred Guest. I was so happy I found a great rate Thursday night on Starwood website for W. I intended to book a room at Westin on Market St as I knew that W would be way out of our price range. Luckily, they had a standard room available at $179 but it was for double beds. I called the Starwood hotline asking for a king bed and actually ended up reserving a 'cool' corner room for $40 more with their AAA rate. I've stayed at this W in SF and New York and knew what to expect: a really hip hotell. Our room was just as described, cool. It was on the 12th floor with views of the Moma. Loved the couch area by the window, loved the decor, loved the bathroom and Bliss products and LOVED everything about the spacious room. I really was kicking myself and wished that we stayed Friday night as well. My fiance loved our room; it was his first time staying at W. The area is convenient. We walked to Union Square on Sunday afternoon and as mentioned we had reservations at Benu on Saturday night. The two things that we did not like: 1) the wall was thin; we could hear the room next to us partying. We didn't mind as they were having fun but it was a Valentine weekend getaway. 2) Parking rate at the hotel was expensive. We found street parking near the restaurant and it worked out that Sunday is free street parking day in the city (most neighborhoods). We had a drink at the bar after dinner. It was definitely hip, crowd. We stayed for one drink as it was 1 am and everyone else in the bar/lounge area was pretty much drunk, except us. There are other hip bars to consider around the area, like Burritt Room and Tunnel Top near the Stockton Tunnel. We would stay here again. It was nice to have a night out in the city and not have to drive home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites with enchanting deco”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelle
Reviews.Content: Ultra-hip, ultra-trendy, sexy but upscale younger crowd! I stayed at the W in SF as a mini-getaway and chose a suite with one king. Turned out to be gorgeous - spacious, well-appointed, top of the line speakers and tvs, two gorgeous bathrooms with wonderful tubs (bonus for people who like to soak!) and a plush bed that I could sink into without getting lost and having to flounder around to get out of. Beautiful views of San Francisco from both rooms in the suite lined by comfy, cushioned window seats and pillows. Trendy, energizing yet zen decorations everywhere that didn't feel like an obligatory afterthought. I'm not usually that impressed by hotel decorations, but the W San Francisco did it! The furniture was sleek, automatically lighted closets (2 in the suite) were a nice touch, comfy and cozy plush bathrobes. The Bliss bath products were nice and go with the fresh younger theme. I requested a toothbrush and a housekeeper was literally knocking on my door with two toothbrush packets a minute later. Love that efficiency! I didn't get a chance to try the complimentary Acura car service, but that's a plus. The location can't be beat - great views on higher floors and close proximity to Union Square, steps from the Museum of Modern Art, and close to all things downtown SF. Great for a night with the girls, tourists with a little extra to spend on lodging, a trendy couple's getaway (great in-room breakfasts), or a younger businessperson.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mobilegirl411
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the W was great. The rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. I stayed in one of the corner rooms that had a king sized bed. The pillows and linens were perfect. Great views of the city....I was able to see the Bay Bridge from one window. The wooden shutters were a nice touch. Next time I would like to take advantage of the Bliss Spa, I just ran out of time! The hotel is in a good location, near lots of shopping and restaurants. Thanks to the staff who were very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel, one of best 'W's I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in dozens of Sheratons and many W all over the world, I would judge this one of the best one - based on great service, friendly employees (and with humor), really working acura service, fantastic room with equally fantastic view, great food (lavish breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Just Average Hotel and Stay”
Reviews.Author: dutchmare
Reviews.Content: We live in the SF area and were attending a conference in the city. We couldn't get into the conference hotel, but my husband's admin was able to get the same rate here. The hotel is very "trendy" with cool lighting, etc. but lacked on some comforts. We arrived during the football play-offs, timing our arrival to miss traffic but still catch the second half. When we arrived at 4:30, our room wasn't ready. They gave us a coupon for a free drink in the bar and said they would call our cell when the room was ready. There was no TV in the bar, so we followed the game on our iPad. After 45 minutes and no call, I went to check on the room and it was ready. Why didn't they let us know? When we got to the room, the TV wasn't working properly. We called the front desk and they did send an engineer up fairly quickly. He was able to fix he TV and we did get to see the last quarter. I agree with other reviewers about the noise of the bathroom door, particularly since my husband got up for business, while I slept in. Also, the bed was very uncomfortable, lumpy and soft, sort of futon-like. We had a corner room on the 28th floor, so it was very quiet with regards to street noise. We did get a ride in the courtesy car when we asked about a taxi, which was good since we had the wrong address and the driver was able to find where we needed to be. Thank you, driver! The location is good, next to Moscone and MOMA. The bar appeared to hopping in the evenings, so if you are into the trendy bar scene this might be a good spot. We felt that our stay was pretty much just average with some good and some bad.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Trendy with First Class Service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: I checked in a few days ago to attend a convention in town. We chose this hotel due to the location. I have to admit when I first checked in, I didn't think I would like it because it is more of a boutique hotel and reminded me of a lounge type atmosphere vs. a business hotel. Well within a few hours of being here I quickly change my mind. First the staff couldn't be nicer and more helpful. The front desk staff were great and we hosted two large meetings hosting 100+ people. The catering was outstanding--both the food and the staff were just great. We received so much positive feedback from our clients. Then we ate here several times and again, the staff was great, the food just incredible. Then I went to get a facial at their Bliss Spa and once again I was absolutely delighted. The woman who did my facial was helpful and really knew her stuff. Now I wish I could stay another week. It is such a great hotel with comfortable rooms complete with bliss products in the bath, delicious food and an incredible staff. Oh and I forgot to mention the best part--their amazing cocktails served in the Lobby Bar. If you have to come to San Fran for any reason, stay at the W, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Slovoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel in San Francisco for almost three straight weeks earlier this year, and hands down - this is my #1 spot in SF going forward. The hotel has the usual W vibe, i.e. special music and lighting in the lobby, attention to details, very strong services team, etc. The rooms, unlike other W's I've visited in the past, are actually spacious and has great natural light (something most W's actually miss), so you can enjoy the 'Work Hard' part in the hotel room (if needed) before the 'Play Hard' part in the lobby/lounge. The bathroom is also quite big, only downside I could find was the low pressure in the shower, nothing too annoying. The heavenly bed (or whatever name they use here) was perfect, and the linens are just too soft. The staff has been extra attentive, always friendly and really sensitive to every small request / detail. During my rather long stay I contacted both Whenever/Whatever and the front desk numerous times and constantly got very helpful reply, real interest in helping me and very friendly stuff. One additional good example is the room service, that ALWAYS beat the time they mentioned over the phone (one time I got my in-room dinner in less than 10 minutes, amazing). The hotel also has an car shuttle service (free of charge, paid by a car company to promote a specific brand) which is useful for the quick rides in the city. Overall, aside from being a little costly (probably less relevant for all you corporate travelers), the experience is great - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better W's around”
Reviews.Author: USAlover_001
Reviews.Content: We went on a family holiday to California last July. After driving more than 7 hours from our hotel in Los Angeles, arriving at the W San Francisco felt like real bliss. At the valet entrance, ample bellboys were waiting to carry our luggage inside. The young lady checking us in was friendly and courteous in this 'casual' way you'll love! A bellboy brought us to our room and explained some room features. We booked this room using the 'Starwood BRG' programme and it showed: our 'Spectacular' rooms had a couple of signature W San Francisco features missing (like the Chinese doll or the chess game) and the mini bar was broke. We called Whatever/Whenever and it was repaired the following day. Our room was spacious and had a 'Spectacular' view over the Oakland Bridge. The window nook is the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the view! The bathroom, with (fabulous!) bliss amenities ofcourse, was rather large and nicely decorated. And then there is the restaurant: the food is to die for (especially their french toast!) and the waiters are wonderful! I want to thank Kim and this other woman working there (I hate myself for nothing remembering her name), who had a chat with us each morning and provided us with great 'insider' tips! The pool is a nice extra but it was crowded most of the time. All in all: staying at the W SF is a wonderful experience (especially with the newly renovated interiors!) and their staf is the hotel's biggest asset! We're sure we'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Crazy, Sexy, Cool”
Reviews.Author: BigBumpaGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cool, even by W standards. The hotel was being renovated during my stay but this did not impact me at all. The rooms were very large, and I was upgraded to a higher level with an excellent view due to the length of stay. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in the city”
Reviews.Author: lucygertrudis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the W San Francisco many times and have yet to be disappointed. The hotel is very modern and the service is excellent. Additionally the location could not be better for enjoying San Francisco's many attractions. There are a number of unique things about this hotel, like every W property, that allow it to stand out from other similar hotels including ipods and lighted buddha statues in the room, a pacman machine in the lobby and fresh fruit out all day long. Additionally there are often exciting promotions including one recently where they provide complimentary rides in a Lexus to the destination of your choice. The rooms are all recently updated and have interesting decor and sleek appliances. The Bliss spa is also fabulous; we have tried many treatments here and never been disappointed. Overall we would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Party Party Planner”
Reviews.Author: p k
Reviews.Content: The sexy yet elusive blonde bombshell who plans the parties is to die for! But in all seriousness, the added atmospheric vibes of the chic parties that grace the hotel bar after hours make you feel like it's 1999 all over again!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent, clean, modern”
Reviews.Author: Mnavarromd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great beds. Location walking distance to downtown

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Dylan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my fiance at the end of december. It was my 2nd time staying at the hotel and was her first. She was blown away with the decor of the hotel lobby and room. My dad was able to secure us a room at the hotel with his corporate rate and we were pleased to find a welcome note and a small gift when we entered our room. It was extremely nice of the hotel staff to acknowledge us and go beyond our expectations to make our stay unforgettable. The resturaunt TRACE that is connected to the hotel is also amazing. Im not sure if the two are under the same management or not but the service from the waiting staff was impeccable. This would be my hotel of choice in SF if I were to return, discounted rate or not.

Reviews.Title: “SF Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SLMcKee
Reviews.Content: My hubby surprised me with a weekend getaway to San Francisco and we stayed at the W becuase this is where we stayed on our first trip together 10 years ago. We arrived at 11 pm on a Friday evening and when we walked in it felt more like a club rahter than a chic hotel. At the time of check-in we waited 25 mins to get checked in....at 11 PM. We were both irritated about the wait and they were also unable to upgrade our room. (i'm a loyal gold spg member) The rooms were updated since our last stay but it was somewhat loud in the hallways in the middle of the night. Overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: Thevitales
Reviews.Content: What a very nice hotel, decors are fantastic. Everyone makes you feel like you are part of the W family. The entire staff is attentive to all your need and extremely helpful. You MUST eat at the hotel restaurant "TRACE", food is to die for, but have to mention the excellent service. We were there for 9 days and would definitively return. The area is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Many Choices In San Fran”
Reviews.Author: EFanucci
Reviews.Content: I could imagine the W having a great looking lobby without the current construction but at this time you just have to put up with the black box room they are using. Front desk, concierge, etc. is all packed into one 30’ x 10’ room and it is not convenient or decorative. Not sure how long this is continuing for but I would check their website if this is a concern for you. This was my first stay in San Francisco and at any W. The staff was mainly young adults, early to mid 20’s. Most were not that helpful regarding places to eat, etc. It was hard to get checked in even at 3:00pm, and yes I understand check-in is at 4:00pm. Had one night free from Starwood points and ended up paying $225 for a cool corner room with the AAA rate. Room was VERY small, but I hear this is the case for most San Francisco hotels. Fire station is right next to the hotel so you will see and hear many fire trucks driving by. Found this out a few times at 3:00am. Also woke up twice due to loud noise within the hallway and doors slamming shut. If you are looking for convenience there are plenty of hotels closer to Market Street. You can avoid the current construction and fire station.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave the room”
Reviews.Author: travelgoo
Reviews.Content: Not much new to say here. I just wanted to document that this was the nicest place I've ever stayed at. We had a regular room for three nights. They were booked as was every where else. We got in kind of late, and they put us in a bad room. It was pretty bad. They were not able to put us into a better room because the place was full, but they took care of us the next nights by putting us in the fabulous room with the wraparound corner window. It had the most amazing views I have ever seen. I wanted to move in. It was so nice that I didn't want to leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular suite: great views of the city”
Reviews.Author: bmm727
Reviews.Content: On my most recent trip to San Francisco for the Christmas holidays, I spent a night at the W San Francisco and decided to splurge a bit with a 28th floor Spectacular Suite. Unfortunately, given that I stayed for only a night - this review will be cursory at best. The overall standards were what I would expect from the W: clean, efficient but casual service, average quality amenities. The room was large and had truly wonderful views of the city (see the pictures). Also, the staff was generally helpful throughout our stay including the next morning when my girlfriend was suffering from an upset stomach. We partook of room service the next day for lunch and the quality was above average for American hotels but certainly not at the same level as the Mandarin in San Francisco or other "5-star" locations. The service staff was a bit intrusive, especially the cleaning lady who kept insisting on coming in despite the fact that we had arranged for a late checkout. The lobby/entrance of the W in San Francisco, like all W's, doubles as the main bar. It was a Thursday evening so the crowd was a bit older and not very heavy which was perfectly fine for 2 severely jet lagged guests. I would say that the San Francisco lobby is not quite as stylish or clubby as the W in Chicago by comparison. It was also overrun by a group of extremely drunk folks from Ireland who were friendly enough but seemed to have trouble avoiding other people. Location-wise the W hotel is ideally situated for people looking to shop (say at the Westfield Mall) in the Union Square area. Certainly, its closer than other hotels like the Mandarin and 4 Seasons which are located in the heart of the business district. As a result, the guests tend to be more along the tourist lines and the hotel clearly caters to them (with only perfunctory business services and amenities) - that may be something other people need to factor in. Overall, the W is clearly a step below the staple 5-star hotels like the Mandarin Oriental in terms of its service, fit and finish. But its stylish and fun and an excellent choice for casual holiday travel.

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_S_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I wrote the following to the W's GM in SF: Dear Mr. Pace, Please know how much I appreciated your F&B Director's (name w/held for this TA review) kindness to my girlfriend who was suffering from a stomach virus, this past weekend, Dec. 3-4. F&B Dir. went above and beyond and exhibited every concern and kindness. To say he represents each W attribute would be an understatement. Finding him in the lobby straightening tables and chairs (I know that doesn't surprise you but it does add to the effect!) on Saturday afternoon, I asked where I might find a drug store to buy medicine. Instead of telling me where the drug store was, he asked what I needed. I showed him my list, he reviewed it, and said "yes, I have this; yes, I can take care of this; and yes, I think I have this in my first aid kit." He inquired how my girlfriend (name redacted for review) was feeling, what he could to assist, and said, "here at the W we take care of our guests. In which room are you staying? I'll have my staff deliver your request immediately, I'll alert them to be on the lookout for any additional needs you may have, and allow us to attend to the bill." Less than fifteen minutes later, F&B Dir. knocked, directed his colleague to place the beautifully arranged tray (cf. attached) on the table, and again asked after my girlfriend (name redacted). There are and were no words to express my appreciation. While there are many who talk about service, and even a few make a valiant effort, fewer still go beyond that extra step to not merely answer the question rather to understand the true need. F&B Dir. did that, and more. Please pass along my deep gratitude for his kindness and generosity. Please know how deeply touched I was by his action, the server's room service delivery, and your kitchen's presentation. Sincerely, Patrick Shaughnessy Chicago, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Hip place to hop around”
Reviews.Author: FloranH
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel close to the local MOmA, I recommend the corner rooms on upper floors, spectacular views. The bar downstairs is quite cool and gets very busy by weekend at night, with a nice young crowd. Definitely a good design place

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdtraveler67
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September when they were on the brink of reopening their restaurant. I wish we had been there just a week later to get to experience Trace! Stayed with a group for a bachelorette in 3 rooms, and they were very helpful in getting our rooms as close together as possible. This was a great location for us to get to restaurants and shopping -- we did take cabs a few places but mostly because we were girls in non-walking heels. The rooms are small, but this is SF. Everything is small. It worked out just fine for us and we even had a little pizza party in the room and everyone could fit just fine. The concierge was very helpful when we were looking for a pizza place to deliver and a bagel place to stop by in the morning before our limo ride to Napa. The beds were very comfortable, and the toiletries were fab since they have a bliss spa in the building. The only awkward thing is the bathroom door, which you can completely see through! Traveling with besties, this wasn't an issue. But it's not very romantic! Overall we had a great experience and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city that wants a bit of an upscale, cool vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Weekend !”
Reviews.Author: GMcCormick
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood member my husband & I decided to check out the newly remodeled W SF for our 6 yr. anniversary. They upgraded us to a lovely Wow Corner Room which overlooked the Bay Bridge...it was just great and the room was decorated + had the space we needed ! Front desk staff & the awesome Acura MDX Experience couldn't have been better - use that perk while visiting the hotel. The only bummer was that they didn't have much for Christmas decorations which I wasn't happy about but the Bliss Spa eased my worries away & we got out and about to see the decorations throughout the city. I give this hotel a A !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Staychel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel -- they upgraded us to a corner room with a great bay view. The location was so-so for tourists. We could walk to Union Square and Chinatown, but needed to take cabs anywhere else. Overall, we were happy and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Upscale”
Reviews.Author: EdChoi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our recent trip to SF. Although the hotel is not the biggest in the area, it's def the most hip and trendy of them all. Service / Hospitality is on point here. Location is great! The best part is their TRACE restaurant and BAR thats extremely popular at night. Since most guests hanging out there are not staying at the hotel, you'll feel like VIP when it's time to head back to your room. The pool on the 4th floor is really nice and will be a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated property and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: This is my first review. The 5th and last time we will stay at ths property. Each time we have arrived at this hotel there is a problem with getting the room we reserved weeks before. Although we have a written confirmation the front desk acts like the room is not available and we stand around for 15-20 minutes to get a room. This after a drive of 7 hours from Southern California. Check out is less than efficient. The hotel was cute when it opened but the quirky messages that make you believe you are getting greater value for common things do not work the 5th year in a row. The furniture needs updating and the beds are horrible. Left with back pain. Don't park your car with the hotel. After a $55 charge for less than 24 hours the car (BMW 750il) was returned with scratches. They gave no appologies, they rather tried to bully themselves out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the adjoining suites - especially with the family”
Reviews.Author: Nieroda
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 adjoining suites (914/915) which worked out great. Kids in one suite, parents in the other. Fun decor, great view, updated lobby (when I walked in I thought I had entered the wrong hotel... they get that regularly)! About the best location - right across from the convention center and a block from either a Peet's or Starbucks. 4th floor gym/pool is nice as well. The 'W' has a deal with Acura where they drive you around the city and check out their newest MDX. We got a ride over to see Beach Blanket Babylon... outrageous, and also highly recommended. Kid friendly shows on Sunday 2pm.

Reviews.Title: “More than just a hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Traveler66
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend at the W Hotel for a quick get-away with my husband. When we first arrived for check-in, we were both a bit overwhelmed by the colors and design of the ultra-modern lobby. However, within a few minutes, we warmed up to our surroundings and were admiring the cube chairs, pink walls and polka dotted glass doors. When we got to our room, it couldn't have been more perfect. With windows across one entire wall and beautiful white wood shutters, the room was gorgeous complete with a seating area in the corner. Unexpectedly, it reminded me of a cozy and beautiful beach house with the light colors and relaxing atmosphere. The views from the 18th floor were amazing!! We especially liked looking down upon the iconic SF Museum of Modern Art's striped tower. While there is a restaurant on the property, we ventured out for breakfast at The Grove and were rewarded with delicious food in a lovely setting. From the hotel, we walked nearly everywhere and took advantage of the complementary transportation for a trip out to dinner in the North Beach neighborhood. This hotel seems to have it all-location, decoration and perfection!! Check it out for a fun weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Such fun! Great use of Starwood points.”
Reviews.Author: chicwhorips
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room with a great view if it was available and we got it. We also ask to check out later and got a 4 pm check out. Yippee! Pool, great with kids. Fun room!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: nlmbanks
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the W in San Francisco. I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews on this property. The location was great, the service was great, the rooms for San Francisco were very large, and the restaurant on site was fantastic! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco! It is in a great area just a few blocks from Union Station. At first we were hesitant to stay here due to the negative comments on trip advisor. My only comment to the negative reviews posted, stay at a brand new hotel next time. Maybe then, everything will be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: charmelly
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for 12 days in November. First let me say the location is fantastic with shops and restaurants within very close walking distance. Now for the hotel! My room was wonderful with a great view of the bridge, contemporary decor, cozy bed, and a great sofa window (not sure what it's official name is). I used the window every morning while having my coffee. The blinds open completely giving you full city views. Hideaway plasma tv, vodka, patron, and lots of other spirits in the room are sure to keep you niiicce. Beautiful lobby, nice lobby bar and great gym. My room was clean, private, peaceful and soothing and the ipod dock helped assure that my stay was very peaceful and calming...and I was there for WORK! I would absolutely recommend you stay here if visiting San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “very good W hotel”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: It might not be the best W hotel I have stayed at but it is up there! I stayed there for 3 nights and everything was very smooth from check-in to check-out! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: ldg_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Oct 20-24th and found what looked like bedbugs in bed. Notified hotel management who contacted Orkin for professional inspection, which confirmed bedbugs. Hotel staff was helpful and diligent in moving me to a new room, comping the night of stay, and treating my luggage. However, they are not offering any assurance of further assistance if I find bedbugs in my home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel, Good Service, Rooms a little old school”
Reviews.Author: Stephersan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Business Conference across the street at Moscone.... GREAT Location - convenient to both the conference, Union Square and tons of main SF attractions. Service and overall experience great - bar downstairs is fun. Rooms, however are a little outdated - phone didn't work, paint on the walls chipped.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: skelly6
Reviews.Content: San Francisco's W is great if you want a downtown location and enjoy an upscale modern feel. I stayed here for a romantic weekend with my wife after an office party in the city. The staff was extremely helpful, and went out of their way to arrange for a nice bottle of champagne, a corner room with a view, and I even had them get some specific flowers for the room as a surprise. While there, the staff seemed friendly and prompt, and we didn't have any problems at all. We had a high room, and I suspect that lower rooms may deal with road noise, as it's at a pretty high-traffic intersection. Their bar (xyz) was great, and we had a great time relaxing downstairs a the other lobby/bar too, which also offered some tasty food options. Overall, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Dim & cheeky w/ good views”
Reviews.Author: Katie D
Reviews.Content: Like most W hotels, it has that dim, fishtank vibe and playful/industrial minimalist/nightclub decor that can seem a bit cheesy for what is essentially a large business hotel/outpost for starpoints junkies. The lobby kind of feels like a used car dealership as imagined by future world at epcot, and I can do without a glowing buddha statue in my room, particularly one with a difficult to locate on/off switch. A for effort, B- for taste level. But I like staying here. My no-frills room had a charming window seat and an amazing panoramic view. Plus, the location is great if you are there for business, and the service is good, the atmosphere is chill and relaxed and the lobby bar area is pretty lively.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill - the 'WOW' has long gone.”
Reviews.Author: Marky London
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here on several occasions since the hotel opened, I was deeply disappointed by this stay. On arrival no assistance was offered with luggage so we found our own way to the temporary check in desk. We discovered there were refurbishments of the ground floor and so the check in area was very disorganised. We stayed in a 'Fantastic Suite' which was very nice with great views, the only downside was poor water pressure so the shower is really only a trickle. Ordered room service as the restaurant was closed due to the refurb - wish we hadn't bothered as it arrived cold and was well below standard. On returning to the hotel late on Saturday night, we were greeted by a young guy who 'fell' out the hotel and vomitted on the sidewalk - a nice welcome back! The lobby area seemed to be filled with (very) young drunk people. Possibly the same that could be heard partying in the hotel in the early hours. The final annoyance was an argument/fight/screaming coming from another guest room in the middle of the night - but at least security did sort that. In general poor service, all style and no substance - just call the Whatever/Whenever service for a demonstration of that. The ineffective W management need to decide if it a nightclub with rooms attached or whether it is a hotel as advertised. After the weekend the hotel was much better but really, the staff need to stop being so 'cool' and drop the W-attitude. The staff need to realise they are actually hotel workers and that guests deserve the service we are paying top-dollar for (and which most of the great people in the industry are happy to provide). Avoid - there are now much better options for the price.

Reviews.Title: “TRACE - restaurant review”
Reviews.Author: LovePlanAndTravel
Reviews.Content: Restaurant Trace is newly opened place within W hotel. We did not stay at the hotel but found an advertisement for the restaurant and decided to visit. We did not regret the choice. The food is incredible. The whole premise is that the origins of every ingredient can be traced back to the local farmer or producer. The dishes are very inventive and one can taste their freshness. The chief does not overwhelm the food with spices and allows natural flavors to mix and melt in your mouth. Wine selection perfectly matches the dishes. Servers are very attentive, polite and not overbearing. Overall - great experience and high recommendations for the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: JChen368
Reviews.Content: W Hotel in San Francisco offers some amazing views from the room of the Bay Bridge. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Small issues: 1) Location is good, but you will need a cab or car to get to most locations 2) Parking is extremely expensive (over $50 overnight)

Reviews.Title: “Groovy, baby - nice staff, a few minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: FizzyBlonde
Reviews.Content: Lobby is off-putting with black everywhere and throbbing techno music. If you are traditional, this may not be your thing (it's not mine). Fortunately, the guest room is lighter and brighter. And if your business is at the Moscone Center, you are literally across the street from it. The staff could not be nicer - every single person was lovely to deal with and very eager to please. The W theme gets old fast, but that's a minor detail. Example - instead of garage they call it Wheels. The button on the phone reads Whatever, Whenever. You get the idea. I was put off when the check-in agent asked if I would like to forego maid service in exchange for having some nominal number of points deposited into my Starwood account. This is ostensibly an environmental initiative, but to me it smacked of cost-cutting at the staff level. Given that California has a 12% unemployment rate, I don't want to be responsible for a hotel maid losing her job, especially at the corporate rate of $319 a night for a regular room. Decor is West Elm meets Anthropologie. Cute little light-up Buddha in the bedroom, nice windowseat, well thought-out built-in desk with lots of compartments, funky headboard, decent bed. Bathroom has glass door, which is a trend I abhor, though I was traveling alone at least. The glass is frosted but still - not enough privacy when traveling with someone else, at least to me. Nice products, good blow dryer and fantastic towels in the bathroom. A/c is acceptable but not great if you like the bedroom really cold at night. Noise control is superb - I didn't hear anything in my room from the hall or other rooms. Room service was friendly but a little bit erratic. There I was in San Francisco and no strawberries were available for breakfast! The strawberries I buy in my ghetto supermarket in Washington D.C. come from California, for cryin' out loud - but the W won't stock them because they are not organic. The fruit selection at breakfast should be better. However, the food was delicious overall and got to my room pretty fast - usually 30 minutes or less. Overall it's a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: danmiller3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W in San Francisco many times before. This last visit I spent three nights and it was an excellent stay overall. The lobby has recently been redone and is much brighter than previously. They did a nice job. The staff is extremely attentive and plentiful. I had a corner room on a high floor with a great view of the city. The rooms are quite large and have lots of sitting areas and the usual comfortable W beds. The desk is very well setup for work and there are plenty of plugs and both wired and wifi for Internet use. The Wifi was usable, but a bit slow. Only two complaints about the stay: 1) The location of the toilet paper roll is ridiculous. This may sound silly, but it's actually very annoying. 2) Water pressure for the shower was low, regardless of the setting. Co-workers reported the same issue in their room so I suspect it's a water saving technique. Overall, great hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nettersbetter
Reviews.Content: This is your typical W hotel -- very modern and chic, which I absolutely love! They provide such great ammenities and really make each guest feel special. I used to travel to SF for work weekly and have stayed here many times. I've always had a great experience. While it isn't in the most convenient location, there are many restaurants and museums close by. It is a 15 min walk to Union Square and a 10 minute walk to the Financial District/Chinatown. There is also a BART station a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Grandma1961
Reviews.Content: O.k., now it wasn't perfect, but what wasn't was so minor, I could not give this property a high enough rating. First off, they impressed us by their welcoming e-mail, that asked us for our wish. We asked for a quiet room, and boy, did they deliver. The bed was incredible, I am such a fan. I was in a super location, and part of my just wanted to cuddle up in the awesome sheets.. We had dinner the first night in the new restaurant, Trace. Food and service were terrific, only downside is the noise from the bar. Way too noisy for a nice dinner. Front desk area was done, still doing work on the bar/lobby area, but it was during the day, so very little distraction. We found everyone, from the concierge to the room attendants to be uber friendly and helpful. The only awkward time came when a bottle of wine showed up in our room on the second day, with a tag on it. It looked like the typical buy this, and we will charge it to your room item. Later, when we checked our bill, we had a $48 charge on it for a bottle that was supposed to be in the room when we checked in. They handled it well, but it was uncomfortable to be in a situation where they obviously weren't sure what had happened to the bottle of wine that should have been there. I would ask that they rethink that policy of leaving something like that in the room, as that was the only real negative of this stay. We tipped the maids daily, and always came back to a terrific room. Location was good, a little walking is always good. Oh, and the last night? There were drums beating for a good 4 hours. Not the hotels fault, but strange....

Reviews.Title: “Swag, in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tat3r
Reviews.Content: The W is always a great place to stay, no matter where. This hotel in SF was not the greatest location, not bad, but not as great as others; however, I do keep in mind that real estate is at a high premium in SF (but the NY locations are great). The rooms are great - appointed better than the Scottsdale, AZ location. The lobby is a welcoming area to relax with a friend over drinks. I love staying at The W's because they are always so stylish & elegant, yet very each one is unique with it's own "flavor".

Reviews.Title: “W SFO”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Bond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August. Well located and friendly hotel staff. Pity about the refurbishment of the front desk, it somewhat removed from the experience. Overall good value except the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: rwsdsc1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the day before and last day of a wine country anniversary trip. We stayed in a corner room the first night and were upgraded to the same the 2nd time around. Rooms are fantasic and hip. Beds are comfortable and the budda lamp is funny. The location is very close to Union Square. If you like hip this is the place for you. The only draw back is price but we were in SF so thats that. The one improvement that could be made is the pressure/spray of the shower head (not very clensing) Could be that the are green building and are trying to save water. That said the water is kind of soft/hard so soap does not come off as I am use to so a stronger shower was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at W hotel in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: safetraveller1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the W hotel in San francisco. The reviews previously discussed their remodel. Unfortunately, I checked out the day of the grand opening but I had a wonderful experience. Check in staff was quick and pleasant. I asked for a coffee machine in my room, snap; done. 2nd day there, they brought in more coffee and fresh cups. Snap: done. I needed some off the over the counter medicine- snap: done. Another meeting participant who has mobility issues, needed some supplies from a local drug store. Snap: done. and I could go on. Room was well appointed, very relaxing. location is very good, next to museum of modern art. thanks My trip was sept. 28-30, 2011. The remodel makes it even better Travel Lover

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Cool, but Small and Loud”
Reviews.Author: Henry C
Reviews.Content: When I lived in San Francisco, I used to come by the W to have drinks with friends at XYZ. I decided to stay at the W on this trip back for a friend's wedding. The W has retained its modern and cool feel, however it does have some draw backs. First the check in area is quite small and can get congested. I know the decor is supposed to be contemporary, but it's a bit too black and dark. Also at least on this trip, they pumped the dance music a bit too loud in the lobby/check-in area. I think it's primarily because of Oracle World this week... but still, the music volume is a bit much. Although others have mentioned security at the hotel entrance, the elevators do require a guest card to access it. The rooms decorated with modern furniture and do feel "cool", however they are a bit on the cramped side. The property is showing a little bit of age, but the room that I stayed in is clean (King bed). The rates were a bit expensive relative to what you get (I had to pay +$600 for corporate), however I think it's because of the Oracle World conference. The bed sheets could be a little more comfortable for what your paying, but they're acceptable. The +30" LCD TV is acceptable for the room size and the entertainment selection is very good (on demand movies, all high def cable, etc). The work area in the room is great for business travelers. The desk has 6 power outlets within easy reach, a dedicated ethernet cable and of course wifi (if you pay for a day, you can connect up to 3 devices). I would say the direct ethernet connection is better vs. wifi...as I found the wifi performance a bit spotty. If you're a Starwood Gold member, you get a free Fiji bottled water with the room. Room service is good and the services is pretty fast. The breakfast I had was excellent. The location of the hotel isn't bad if you're spending time downtown or in SOMA. You're pretty much within walking distance of shopping, food and major public transit. If you're looking for a high end place that is modern to stay in the same general area, I'd recommend the St. Regis or the Intercontinental over the W.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: naomifl73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love W hotels and have stayed at several locations across the country. We were very excited about this trip and this hotel but it was nothing but a huge disappointment. The hotel was under construction and it was very cramped. It did not appear that there would be nice areas to meet or lounge around even after completion. The bar had over priced drinks, the rooms were nothing special, and the food was mediocre, and the walls are paper thin so you hear doors slamming constantly while you try to sleep. The hotel did nothing to compensate for all of it's deficiencies during construction. There is no way I would ever visit this hotel again, it really had a negative impact on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The "W" Stands for Worst in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Maybe I should tell you that the W hotel San Francisco used to be one of my favorite hotels in the city. The rooms were stylish, sexy, comfortable and the public areas were lively, clean and attractive. Not anymore. It’s a design disaster! The second thing you should know is that the hotel is undergoing major renovation – major. A fact that we were never informed of at any part of our reservation process. There is no lobby and the makeshift check in area is truly deplorable. There are work lights, tarps, paint and pathetic “oops” signs everywhere – letting you know that acknowledged that problem. Maybe they could tell you about the problem before you book the hotel. If the lobby wasn’t enough reason not to stay here – the remodeled guest rooms definitely are. The rooms are now a disaster of crappy furniture, white walls, tan carpet and broken plastic Buddha’s. As a designer myself, I have fallen in love with many W Hotels’ designs in the past—I understand and appreciate good design. This is not good design. The room looks like someone made a last minute dash to a Japanese version of IKEA and slapped crap on the walls, put together cheap furniture and left before it was finished. The room décor is a disaster. It is also pathetic to see remnants of the old décor still pathetically left behind: a dark wood headboard, a sink, a mirror, drapery tracks on the ceiling without drapes. None of it works. It’s hard to choose the worst element in the room. The freeform mirror glued onto the old headboard? The plastic Japanese “art” pathetically installed on the wall? Or maybe the random lamp balancing on the edge of the desk that obviously didn’t fit into its nook? The new disastrous design also makes its way into the W restaurant Trace. Before I tell you about the restaurant, let me say the staff at the restaurant was excellent and the cuisine was very good. The restaurant is also a design disaster. If the challenge was to take a great space and break it into 17 cramped and uncomfortable areas—mission accomplished! The cheap looking décor looks like it came from the same Japanese IKEA and someone has the novel idea of making black wood cages in which to place the tables. Even the waiters complain about navigating the maze of cramped tables and black wood crates. There is also a “dot” pattern on the wall and windows, a theme that permeates the new areas, and it is annoying, tedious and already dated. Whew! In short, I would never stay here again and I felt truly ripped off. Something I usually have not felt at any other W hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, unique -- business functions need more attention”
Reviews.Author: MRL217
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nicely appointed, clean and quiet. To be fair, the hotel was undergoing renovations; however, the small lounge area that doubled for breakfast was cramped and service slow. Business meeting space was mediocre at best -- temperature fluctuation (mostly too cold) and not good about refreshing water, etc.,; also, little to no policing of food and beverages served outside room -- in fact, the group next door helped themselves to our refreshments at their leisure. When brought to staff's attention, we got little more than a shrug of the shoulders. Front desk were friendly and attentive and overall, the property is worth a stay -- nicely located in downtown within walking distance of lots.

Reviews.Title: “Best Restaurant - TRACE - Health & Fresh - want to bring Chef home!”
Reviews.Author: CYfromHK
Reviews.Content: Always nice to spend a weekend in San Francisco after a crazy business weeek, a short ride from airport, hotel lobby is rather small to me as they are undergoing some expansion. Staff at front desk was very friendly although concierge did not find my courier which was reconfirmed before arrived. After several hours, they found it. Well done to Whatever Whenever ! Room is spacious with a touch of Asian/Japanese zen feel, like the colour bed panel but strange to see a Chinese Lion and Buddist with light in the room. found W Chess on the table - very cute. Bed is comfortable thou... W got the best mattress always! Travelling alone, you ended eating in the hotel all the times. With only one restaurant - TRACE (I was told it's newly opened and difficult to get a table). Checked on menu, not a long one and tried the recommended Vegetarian Pasta with fresh tomanto sauce - Yum! Next day, I tried the recommended Grill Chicken - not oily, tender, right portion. The best came the last was the Egg White Omelette with spinash - the best ever in my life - light, fresh and just right. Salute to the Chef! Almost wanna to pack the Chef wtih to Hong Kong.... One more thing, the hotel offer free bicycle - great ideal to travel around SF city as the city is so easy to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, very nice and efficient staff.”
Reviews.Author: FranGalan
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was pretty good, some disappointments and good surprises thought, they are still doing works in the lobby, so there is non, the check in area kind of give you the wrong impression at fist... they had the Acura promotion and we used a car service to pier 39 for free, nice surprise thought. The first night we we're falling a sleep and next room a bunch of lads decided to start a party and make lots of noise.. we call reception and they sent security and sorted it out in no time. The food at the bar was OK, the gym area and the pool was nice. The area is quite safe during the day, I wouldn't go for a stroll at night.... at the end of the day it's San Francisco...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs to be honest”
Reviews.Author: kwillie0331
Reviews.Content: I have been planning my trip to San Fransisco for months and was so excited. I am a review reader and after reading many I decided to go with this location. Well the understatement would be that I was very disappointed. I called the hotel several times before I even arrived asking questions about the area and the hotel and was never told about the extent of the renovation. My room was small for the price and I had to ask for a refridgerator which I would think would be standard. I was told upon check in that I would be contacted the next day to see if I could be moved to a better room but of course I never was contacted thus having to stay in this room. The sliding bathroom door with no way to secure it made me very uncomfortable and lacked privacy. I was told that even though the computer center was on the 3rd floor if I went to the second floor with my own laptop I could browse for free as to avoid the cost to use my own laptop in my over priced room. Of course it did not work and the staff there was of no help so a nice man at the bar allowed me to use his wireless card in his cell phone to get on. I could go on and on but I think I might save the rest for the letter I plan on writing the company. Just as a wrap up to the unpleasant stay upon check out I was told the computer system for the hotel had crashed and they had no way of printing my bill or allowing me to pay in cash which I had made clear upon check in that I had planned to do so. I wasnt even able to find out how much was being charged to my credit card until I got an email the next day which even that price was not what I was quoted.

Reviews.Title: “The power of communication!”
Reviews.Author: earthtravelers
Reviews.Content: We had planned a very important family event at this property, booked rooms well in advance and sent a request for progress information on the refurbishment of the hotel lobby and public areas and never heard back. We were all very excited to stay next to the wonderful museum of modern art and were rather disappointed as we got there: the entrance was a side corridor, noisy, disorganized with people behind desks who did not look trendy but shabby and about as unhelpful as they come. The racket was infernal, construction everywhere, interior design which was no longer trendy, tired decor in rooms with heavy and duvets, unusable seating area and bathrooms without adequate privacy....complete with peeling wallpaper and bashed up woodwork....The bar was heaving with all sorts of characters, not one spot for residents despite affirmations to the contrary. Come on Westin, you don't know how to do boutique so do what you are mostly adequate at: factory style hotels with impersonal staff and cookie cutter service and leave the boutique hotels to those who have real imagination and are not shackled by the corporate noose. We eventually got an upgrade for our daughter and son-in-law and as they complained at checkout they got.....$50 of their bill.....we got absolutely nothing but major disappointment, but of course that would have required empathy, a word to mull over and develop amongst the meaningless buzzwords bandied around on boring t-shirts.
