We love San Francisco, have stayed at great hotels there in the past and will surely again but would advise everyone looking for an refined, upmarket and hip hotel to steer well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Delusions of adequacy”
Reviews.Author: BusinessPilgrim
Reviews.Content: If you like pretentious hotels that are currently a building site and charge you $6 to wash a T-shirt, then this hotel is for you. To start with the building works; the hotel really should have closed during the reconstruction as there is absolutely no lobby or bar space and it feels more like a low costs lodging room building - but at $300 a night rather that $30. Short-term just don't stay here, long-term this decision to stay open is going to hurt the W's reputation a lot. Even if the building was in perfect nick, the pretentiousness would still be truly gag-inducing. Ask for bell-boy to bring a coffee machine to your room (shouldn't they be there anywhere in a a 5*?) and reception will announce that they are sending up their "room stylist". There is a lot of "sending up" going on at this hotel but mainly of the guests. Reception desks are labelled "Whenever" and "Whatever" while the door guys wear T-shirts asking"What Next?". When Apple does this in its stores it is somehow ironic wit. When the W does it it comes across as a crass attempt at being cool that is actually just irritating. But nothing beyond the superficiality of slogans and a rather noisy air conditioning system supports the hotels supposed chilled status. The rooms are OK, but little more. The location is all right, but then so are the St. Regis, the Westin and the Four Seasons. My final gripe is the ease with which you can spot the reviews on tripadvisor that have clearly been written by the hotel's staff or its PR agency. Take a look, they are quite easy to spot (they start with something that established credentials - "staying here on a business trip" for example, then heap praise on location, facilities and comfort and end with a round of applause for the wonderful staff). But the mere fact that they are trying to "astro-turf" (as the term for falsifying grass root comments is known) just shows that this hotel, behind the make-up, is just a little bit sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W San Francisco hotel for a Bachelors party. The location is perfect especially if you are attending a conference at Moscone Center across the street. The W San Francisco hotel is also directly opposite the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. I found the hotel very easy to access from the street by walking, taxi and car. Don’t park at the hotel unless you want to pay $60 per day. I would recommend you park one block up the up 3rd avenue at Hearst Parking Center. Hearst Parking Center is only $23 per day and less than 5 minutes’ walk from the hotel. The W San Francisco hotel has some construction taking place on the ground floor. However I believe it is completed at the end of September. The restaurant and bar on the second floor has been completed. Due to the construction the lobby is a little small however the service was fast and efficient. I never ate in the restaurant or went to the bar. Since I live in the bay area I bought a cooler box with me full of beers!! W San Francisco hotel has a Peets and Starbucks coffee one block away. I ate breakfast at Peets Coffee. Most W hotels put out coffee in the lobby in the morning. I would also recommend using the pool. I didn’t like the foam in the hot tub. Hotel also has a nice gym and provides green apples all day long. Don’t forget the Bliss cleaning towel available in the Gym. I normally take a few packs to wipe my face on the flight home. I love the Bliss products in the W hotel. Try finding the housekeeping cart!! Overall I think the W San Francisco hotel is better than the Westin Market and 3rd Street two blocks away. The rooms are smaller in the W San Francisco than the Westin. I found the bedside radio didn’t work in the room with my iphone. Also the glasses where chipped. Prior to arriving I spoke with hotel management and advised them about the Bachelors party. Hotel management sends up a basket of beers, olives and nuts. It was a nice touch and the bachelor was impressed. I would stay at the W the next time I need to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: rick2075
Reviews.Content: We were married at the W San Francisco this past July and although it has been several months since the event, we still hear rave reviews from our guests. Our wedding co-ordinator at the W, Annalee, was nothing shy of spectacular. She and her team managed every aspect of our event and made it a truly unforgettable experience. The ceremony space was simply phenomenal yet paled in comparison to the lighting and colors of the "Great Room" (where we held the reception)! The sound was perfect for our entertainment and the entire atmosphere was just magical! The attentiveness of all of the W's service staff were top notch and worked flawlessly to not only take care of us but all of our guests as well. The food prepared by the culinary team lead by Chef Jason, were exquisite! From tantilizing hors d'oeurves of tuna tartare, the succulent main course of butter poached sea bass, and of course the delicious cheescake lollipops (just a small sampling of the mouth-watering menu they created specifically for us) - the food was a work of art that matched the venue to a "T". The hotel rooms themselves were as equally stunning - sweeping views of the city and well decorated all helped to create a sense of awe for our out of town guests. Having been a former chef of an upscale hotel where I was part of many a wedding in the past - I believe that I offer a unique persepective to this review as I am partiucular and a very critical judge of the hospitality industry. If you are even remotely thinking of hosting an event in SF, you should contact Annalee and the W - they will treat you as royalty and they truly are the best! My thanks goes out to Annalee and the rest of the W San Francisco staff!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was under renovation when we visited, so it was rather congested. The location is great. Many restaurants and museums nearby. The Mission Street Garage is 2-3 blocks away, so if you are driving but carrying limited number of carry-ons, the cost at the Garage is less expensive. You are next door to the MoMA, and within walking distance from the shopping area of town. The rooms are on the smaller side, but sufficient. The bathroom door is made out of almost-see-through frosted glass, so roommates beware. A good alternative from locations around Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I prefer to stay in boutique hotels. I was really looking forward to staying at W San Francisco, as it was our first stay with the W Hotel group. Let down happened as soon as we walked into the hotel. Lobby was under construction. During the working hours, the banging and saws were extremely loud. The Hotel bar and restaurant also paid the price during construction. Noise made it unpleasant. Outside of construction, would I go back after the reno? NO. I still think the hotel is over priced for what you get. The room was comfortable, they definitely went for the minimalist style. On the good side, W is located in a great section of town. We loved being in the SOMA area. Out of the throng of tourists at Fisherman's wharf, but great access to all parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever? Whenever? The real question is why bother!”
Reviews.Author: Lorne_Alexandra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a visit to the W San Francisco. We have stayed at a number of Starwood properties, and a few W hotels in the past. This visit was far below our expectations. We tried to speak with the concierge upon our arrival, but after waiting 20 minutes, decided not to wait any longer. The next morning we tried to phone the concierge, I waited on hold for 30 minutes, and then hung up. I phoned the fornt desk to ask for an address (as there is a charge for WiFi in the guest rooms, something I have not encountered in a long while, and honestly, felt a bit like being nickeled and dimed), and was again transfered to hold for the concierge. We thought the Acura service was a nice touch, until we tried to use it. We phoned to make an advance reservation, and were told to call back the day we wanted to use the service. Upon doing so, we were told that the service ended at 7:00pm and was fully booked. Our room was decorated in the W style (read: Ikea). There was very little water pressure in our shower. For a cup of coffee in the morning, we were told to go to the lobby as there was no in room coffee maker. In summary, my husband and I left this property vowing not to stay at another W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Very Consistant”
Reviews.Author: jjgSummit
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, i dont love this hotel, i like ths hotel. I like it because its comfortable, quiet with very little street noise and the service is solid. They are remodeling the lobby lounge area so that was somewhat dissapointing on the last visit but the breakfast is good and the bar is good as well. I love the st. regis 1 block away but find that hotel to be very noisy from a street noise standpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Won't compare to other W hotels you may have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: candygirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was missing that coolness factor that you find at many other W hotels. They were undergoing renovations to lobby during stay and perhaps that had something to do with it. Rooms are small with double beds. When I asked if we could get a room with 2 queen beds they said they didn't have any. It is hard to move around in the "spectacular" room and the decor hasn't been updated in a while. It would have been impressive in 1995 but not 2011. We orders room service that took an hour and a half. Also ran out of toilet paper as none extra in our room. The spot to catch a taxi wasn't the best and many times we were on our own to catch a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms”
Reviews.Author: TGM73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights before we started a conference. The room was very comfortable with a great bed so tick in the most important box straight away. Location is fantastic for seeing central SFO with everything on your doorstep. The only negative I have is I thought it was a bit over priced. I would stay there again but would want the work to reception to be finished.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it for families”
Reviews.Author: workingjapan
Reviews.Content: Stayed with kids. Service was poor and it was under construction. No one told us before we booked or arrived. Good place for young 20's to party and crash. Stay away families. Cheap room price but everything else is up charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and trendy”
Reviews.Author: jenny518
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night, but wished I could have stayed longer to enjoy the amenities of the hotel. The W is beautifully decorated and conveniently located. It would be perfect for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, free chauffeur service”
Reviews.Author: Tony K
Reviews.Content: Really modern hotel. Got a low upgrade despite being starwood plat but still had a really nice room, quite spacious for a W. Just like other W hotels, they offer a free Accura with driver to take you to places around the city for free. It was quite convenient. Only problem of the stay was that I had to wait for more than 40 minutes waiting for my suitcase to come back from the baggage check. On the other hand, management apologized very nicely and offered me a couple of thousand spg points for the problems caused. Staff is also really nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it! Great city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: iheartvaca
Reviews.Content: Arrival is kind of random, as the lobby is under construction, so you're directed to an area near valet with podiums for check in. When the lobby renovation is complete, it will make for a much more welcoming vibe. We arrived very early and didn't expect to check in, but just wanted to drop our bags off and head out to explore a bit, but we were given a room key right away, which was welcome news to us tired travelers. Our room was as expected for a W- a little funky and modern with nice touches, like good linens, Bliss Products, etc. We booked the hotel with Starwood points, and they upgraded us to a "spectacular" room and we had a nice view of the Bay Bridge, and a large pillowed window seat to enjoy it by. The hotel offers a very nice service, offering free drop off in a luxury SUV until 8 p.m. You will still need to figure out transportation on the way back. There are always little treats on rotation in the lobby, as well as fruit-infused water, coffee, cookies, etc. depending on the time of day. The location is very good as well; you will have plenty of fine restaurants readily available all times of the day. I am reading in other reviews about the bar, but we didn't know it existed, which is not a big deal, but something the hotel should maybe mention at check-in. We never ate at the onsite restaurant and honestly I'm not even sure how you get to it, as the only common areas of the hotel we saw were the lobby and elevator area. If you want a nice hotel with great service, semi-luxury rooms, etc. the W is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: EndaGuinan
Reviews.Content: Undeniably great location, but missing many of the touches that could make it great for the price. The lobby was under construction when we arrived making check in and out chaotic. We had to make five phone calls to get a corkscrew - very poor for a hotel in this category. They have an attentive Twitter account which responded to my whining, but they missed an opportunity. Instead of PR gloss, try "You had to wait for hours for a corkscrew? Have a drink on us" The room was ok and the dining area was a little dull and the food nothing special at all. Overall, a pricey disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms will make you smile”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: August 2011- Hotel is undergoing a bit of a face lift. Not a major remodel. Does not affect rooms or noise, in my experience. Check in : Very quick and friendly, however there was no :"preferred" line for SPG members. It was very busy, but the staff was moving as fast as they could. Room: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel. Room is on the smaller side, but very cheery. soothing walls with added pops of color, art, and accessories. Accessories need to be noted as they are things like little lamps, a Budha nightlight (that changes color) books. staggerd shelving, vases. I had a corner room and the corner couches had decorative pillows with a round coffee table. It made for a nice sitting area and overlooked the city. Windows have nice wide shutters. Location: Located 2 block South of Market Street. A less than 10 minute will have you enjoying great shopping, or easy access to the BART system. Room Service: Food was excellent. Ordered what was recommended. Local salmon cooked to perfection, one of the best I have had. Arrived in less than 30 minutes, with a smile. Bath: Large Bathroom with a tub/shower combo. Lots of vanity space and shelving to hold extras. Robes provided and plenty of towels. Bath line is from "Bliss". What I find interesting is that you can go shopping without leaving your room. Room is stocked with items for sale such as wine by the bottle, hats, robes, Ipod docks, candy, nuts, chips, first aid kit, tote bags, and items for "adult safe encounters". There is a fully stocked mini bar also. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, fun touches and close to Moscone”
Reviews.Author: JC_Cangilla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for business and a quick client trip out to Napa. Spacious W-designed rooms (much like W Union Sq and W Midtown Atlanta). Clean, staff seemed helpful. When I'm away from home, I do appreciate the small things; W San Francisco seems to have figured this out. During this stay, in the mornings, I had iron my shirts and suit coats. I'm also typically in a hurry and have to dash out the door in the morning. The housekeeping staff at the W San Francisco put the ironing board away--while this may seem like a small thing, I really appreciate it. Nothing worse than coming home from a long business day and a hug ironing board filling up my living space. Small negatives: Currently (Aug 2011) going through construction in lobby and XYZ restaurant--I got lost one morning going into the restaurant. Temporary lobby is tiny (no chairs, confusing queues).

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend in SF”
Reviews.Author: Canouan
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at W and every good as we remember. Sorry that the entire lobby and restaurant lounge was under renovation while we were there. No noise but a very tiny check lobby and no other space made it a little tight. Use to love having breakfast in the big restaurant on 3rd St so look forward to seeing the final. We had a great room on 23 floor with fantastic city view. Usual W amenities and great staff. Love the location - better than staying at Union Sq as in the past. Definately on our favorite and return list.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to the conference center”
Reviews.Author: ciphertext
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the W Hotel chain and enjoyed my stay here, although I have to admit that this wasn't the nicest W Hotel at which I've stayed. It is fairly expensive but in terms of proximity to the conference center, you can't get much closer than this. But if cost is a factor and you don't mind walking a few more minutes to the conference center, you might want to look elsewhere. PROS: I liked the comfortable beds and the hotel had a nice lively lounge. CONS: I wasn't a huge fan of the decor in my room which was decorated with a glowing buddha statue that changed colours and a porcelain doll of a chinese girl. Very bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of a major remodeling...no lobby”
Reviews.Author: WAS215
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is missing as it's being rebuilt. I wish i had know that as there was no real public place to meet....except for the restaurant which was hard to access from the lobby. As a result I move all my meetings to the St. Regis lobby. If I had known about the remodeling I would not have stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Views”
Reviews.Author: DufferDave
Reviews.Content: We thought the W Hotel was awesome. They were remodeling the lobby, but the personnell were fantastic. Definetly worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar downstairs!”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: $55 a day for parking. Room are a bit small. Asked to be upgraded and was actually given a smaller room. Good location! Although main bar was being remodeled, the lobby bar was a lot of fun. Great food as well.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY”
Reviews.Author: JasonMacNo6
Reviews.Content: Switched rooms twice and it was like a holiday inn in Idaho. Dirty, messy. NASTY.

Reviews.Title: “nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: lorneparker
Reviews.Content: It could have been the fact that they are currently undergoing major renovations in the lobby area but we didn't think that the size, decor and ambiance of this hotel lived up to a 4 star rating and 4 star price. We have also stayed at the Le Meridien and Omni hotels in San Fran and for a similar price, found they offered more welcoming service and luxurious surroundings. That being said, there were no major complaints and the location of the hotel was very convenient to Union Square and other downtown attractions. Our room was also very quiet with no noise from the hallway or from surrounding rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugg80
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to the Museum of Modern Art. Close to shopping without having the crowds, homeless, etc. Good recommendations from the concierge on things to do and places to eat. (Made the yelp hunt a lot easier, there are too many great choices for food in San Fran). Nice gym, including a lap pool. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice location”
Reviews.Author: desimunda420
Reviews.Content: For some reason my review didn't get loaded the last time and I can't take the time out to re-write the whole darn thing...so here goes the short summary: THE GREAT - Great service (more details below), nice location with respect to BART - Didn't get the room of our choice initially but security personnel showed us around the other rooms in the hotel till we found the perfect room. Many thanks to her - Danella (I might have spelled her name wrong but she was awesome!) - I had mentioned to the staff that we were on our honeymoon during some conversation and surprisingly they sent us a piece of chocolate cake, complimentary along with a personal note welcoming us - Fantastic!! - Very polite, courteous staff, The NOT-SO-GREAT - Pool/Jacuzzi was pretty dirty, didn't feel like going there after the first trip there - Acura car service had too many restrictions in terms of hours of operation, waiting time and places it could take you (not even to a local train station) but oh well, it was not everything, don't pin your hopes on that service) - Location was nice but I would have chosen something closer to Union square seeing where this hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “Probably my least favorite W thus far”
Reviews.Author: Mfgib197
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W San Francisco a couple weeks back on a Friday and Saturday evening, ending up 6 days in northern Cali. Compared to other brand properties where I stay regularly, was disappointed. Service via front desk was uneven, with some employees being very helpful and kind and an equal number of others acting indifferent to guests, pick-and-choosing whom to serve regardless of place in line, finding a way to redirect questions, etc. Call this paranoid, but at a couple of times I think I noticed a couple of the hotel goons snarking and sort of snickering at guests. Had to get my key card remagnetized (really? At a W for $250 a night?) I did find my room and view pretty cool, but all things considered including an only-ok location and kind of a dark poseur vibe emanating from almost everyone in the building, I would not stay here again regardless of my Starwood affiliation or points. Too many other good choices in San Fran to try to be cool at a property that is smug and already thinks it's too cool.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: travel_much_9
Reviews.Content: II knew there were renovations going on but it was actually worse than I expected. We booked a corner room, and we were given 2901 (29th Floor) with nice views of San Francisco bay bridge. The hotel was in the small size so that was almost a deal breaker for me. I have stayed in other San Francisco hotels with bigger rooms so I know it can be done, also about the same or even less price. The location is not bad but not optimal either. SFMOMA is next door so that was nice and the Stein collection is a must right now. I mostly booked this hotel because I wanted to get a facial at Bliss spa and I’m glad I did. I booked the double-oxygen facial and the experience was truly unique and the aesthetician was friendly and knowledgeable – I did notice an improvement on my facial skin. I did use the gym and that was also very small. The reception area seemed very busy the entire weekend we were there, granted it was during the summer which is their higher season. Hopefully, after they are done with the renovations things will improve but for the time being I will say – stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: Shube1
Reviews.Content: The W never fails except it can get rowdy on Saturday night with the young set and loud music look pass this the wow corners rooms are amazing and we had a great time freindly staff and superb service

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming service and a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerinPS
Reviews.Content: W in SF was perfect. The staff couldn't be nicer, rooms well laid out and beautifully decorated. Our room was called a "fabulous king corner" room and it lived up to the task. Staff always followed up with phone call to check if any request had been handled. Comfortable room with great seating area and separate desk. Lots of electric plugs in convenient places to charge and recharge all those gadgets. Looking forward to the next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Porperty was just OK, Service / Experience was a Joke”
Reviews.Author: intbslt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in mid July 2011. The lobby was undergoing some construction - annoying but not a permanent ding on their record. The experience though, was probably the worst I'd had in a hotel that costs more than $100 / night. I arrived and unpacked. Got out the ironing board to iron a shirt for a dinner that night and the iron spit out spots of rust at my shirt. I called down to have the shirt cleaned and a new ironing board sent up. When I returned to the room, the shirt was gone to the cleaners but no new iron / board. I then ordered room service because the dinner meeting was more drinks than anything. They brought the wrong order - I ate it anyway because I was hungry. Wake up halfway through the night to a glowing buddha and have to scrounge around behind the desk to figure out how to unplug it. My shirt was returned the next day - the cleaners were not able to get the rust stains completely out - $100 shirt ruined. I thought, screw it...time for a new shirt anyway. Following morning I hop out of the shower to no towels - only a hand towel and a small wash rag?!? I head over for the last day of the conference and leave my bag at the bell check. I was reluctant to even leave it given their track-record so far but have no choice. When I return for my bag (with limited time to make it to the airport), nobody can find the bellman. I befriend "Bill", the extremely helpful chief engineer of the building, and accompany him up three floors to the room where the bags are being held. We borrow a key from another employee of the hotel so we can enter the room and find the bag ourselves. It was such a debacle that I didn't even complain because I won't stay there again so getting any future benefits / compliments would be meaningless. Bill, the engineer, was the property's only redeeming quality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Paolinatravels
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the W San Francisco. The location is great, with the SF MOMA next door, the Yerba Buena Gardens across the street and Market Street steps away. We were upgraded in a Fantastic room at the 23rd floor with a breathtaking view on Bay Bridge and the city. The room is very comfortable, the decor is fresh and colourful, and the bed is just amazing. The staff was absolutely lovely and thoughtful, breakfast was so fresh and delicious, and we fell in love with the swimming pool with its glass roof ! Unfortunately the restaurant was close for renovation but I'm sure it will be great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Still fun design, construction's a bit of a bother”
Reviews.Author: ticoticotico
Reviews.Content: I've always enjoyed the whimsical design that's found at the W SF, and this visit was no exception. I did find that the service quality has dropped a bit, with cavalier staff, no in-room treat as in prior years, and no updates for the last three years. The rooms have compelling views of the Bay Bridge and a wonderful under-the-window reclining area. For the price, it's not bad, and if you like a fairly trendy environment, this W delivers pretty well. I'm not sure why, but I just can't shake the feeling that the service wasn't up to par versus the last couple times. Still, I'd stay here again because it's the perfect venue for Moscone center conferences. Internet was massively expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: s_sill
Reviews.Content: Husband and I spent one night at the W for our anniversary. Upon arrival, I was a little thrown back by the fact that the bar was right near the entrance doors. They had a DJ playing the worst music ever (house music - gag) and it was REALLY loud. After navigating through the noise and crowd, we found the front desk. The girl at the front desk was AMAZING! She asked if it was a special occasion and we told her yes. She bumped us up to the 26th floor with an amazing view. She also gave us vouchers for 2 free drinks. The room was small but confortable and very clean. Bed was perfect, so much so, I was asleep by 10pm (hubby didn't like that!lol) One negative is there was no coffee maker in the room and I have to have coffee. Luckily all you have to do is call the front desk to request one. We went out to smoke and when we came back we had a coffee maker and a free anniversary dessert waiting for us. They really made us feel special. Parking is normal for the area (about $55 to park overnight). You definitely want to call them about 30mins before you're going down or you'll have to stand there and wait. The room service menu had nothing that I wanted but you are in the heart of SF and there is plenty of food in walking distance. I suggest Amber Indian Restaurant, it is one of the best! The pool is small and I believe it only had 5 chairs total. The pool is almost 24hrs, I believe its closed from 2-4am. Even though its small, if you go at the right it, you can have it all to yourself. Overall, this place is very nice and I would have given 5 stars but I don't give 5 stars to anyone. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: NZ2010London
Reviews.Content: Arrival experience not in keeping with that at other W's or 5 star hotels, nobody at door to assist with luggage - Of which we had plenty - Luggage desk seems to be at back of lobby away from door. Had to try navigate through a busy bar to the reception. Was a really hot week when we stayed and the roof terrace had a deserted marque on it so couldn't be used. Everything was just Average from the service to the room - Not the WOW I have previously experienced. The lady on the concierge desk was very helpful, the guy who said he had just started shouldn't have been left on his own with level of knowledge as not particularly helpful. Whilst not a bad stay expectation for price and brand is not Average.

Reviews.Title: “Love your hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: D_Dwallen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a few days in the city and LOVED your hotel! Dustin who assisted us with luggage to the room was super helpful! All of the staff in the Living Room from the doorman to the bartenders were great! Our room was FANTASTIC! We left in a hurry and left some meaningful items in the room. I called about an hour after we checked out and talked to Sal in security who very quickly ran to our room, grabbed the items and shipped them home safely. I wish I remembered names of all the employees that helped us - they were all superb! The hotel is in the perfect location! We loved it and will definitely stay here whenever we return to SF!

Reviews.Title: “A solid option in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel in San Francisco in May 2010. At check-in, we were told that our room had been upgraded, which was not the case. This is not a big deal, given that we had reserved a large corner room, but it was strange. The W hotel concept seems slightly out of place in a hotel this large. At three times the size, the personal touch and some of the services that we take for granted at W in Montreal are either lost or fully booked at W in San Francisco. The guide books list this as a “boutique”hotel, but despite the funky décor in the lobby, the elevators, and the guestrooms, it seemed more generic and anonymous. All of that aside, it is a very nice, comfortable hotel. There are very nice views, and it is convenient for public transportation and walking. The pool, deck, and fitness facilities seemed nice,though the deck was closed and covered in a tent. It is a very solid option among four-star hotels. Overall, we would stay here again, but we would look around at other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: my5qtz
Reviews.Content: **If you like morning coffee (even if it's crappy drip) to open your eyes, request a coffee maker right when you get to your room or at the front desk. YOU MUST REQUEST IT! It's not in the room by default. I find this ridiculous and have only had to do this one other time at the Cypress Hotel in Cupertino. Really, who wants to get dressed and put on shoes to go fetch their own coffee in the bustling lobby? And I don't particularly like opening the door to room service in my PJS.** We paid a little over $250 a night for a double room with a high floor city view. We were traveling as a family with our 13 and 1 year old daughters for 2 nights. We are from the South Bay, wanting just a couple of nights in the city to celebrate our 13 year old's birthday. She chose the W based on the modern & whimsical decor. It was our first stay. W Wheels: We drove into the city in our car. The turn off for valet was a sharp turn down a narrow covered alley. We had to lap the block because we missed it the first time, no big deal. Valet were helpful and polite. Parking is expensive, I think I overheard $48/day with in-out privileges. This makes one cringe, but it is standard in an old/crowded city like SF and we knew it would be a hefty fee to park the car. The Lobby was under construction during our stay so it was very cramped, but again, we knew that in advanced from the hotel website. It wasn't an issue and although our stay was over the weekend, we never heard any disruption evident of ongoing construction. Staff at the front desk was efficient and courteous. We did not utilize the car service, bell service, concierge, fitness, spa, or room service during our stay. Oh wait, I *did* use the fitness room - I refilled my water bottle from the cooler there. Why? Because the FIJI in the room was $6 for a teeny bottle. Go to one of the many many many Walgreen's within walking distance and buy your own water bottle(s)! Previous reviewers noted that the key-card elevator was complicated, but we didn't find this to be a problem (at least worth mentioning). (Weird, but given the clubby feeling to the downstairs, I can see them wanting to deter too many non-guests from the upper floors.) However, they'll just clomp up and down the metal stairwell (see below). The room decor at the hotel is light and airy, the view was great. The condition was fairly clean, good condition, minor wear and tear. My husband who travels for business felt that the desk area had a bit too much clutter for his taste, I thought it was cute and it had a lot of plugs. I was more concerned about the idea of a community wooden foot massage under the desk...maybe ok for home, but at a hotel? No thanks! But moreso, it prevented the desk chair from being pushed in all the way and the room is a bit tight on space! Lots of good adjustable lighting in the room, very bright, or soft and dim. The lava lamp buddha was noted as "cool" by my 13 year old and husband. (Same husband who felt the little organized paperclip, notepaper and pencil holder on the desk was cluttered, actually LIKED the bright glowing Buddha that prevented the baby from going to sleep, lol!) Beds were comfortable with a feather top and nice sheets and pillows. I do my typical "bedbug" check whenever I get to a hotel and pull up everything. Let's just say that housekeeping doesn't check the mattresses very well - could've used a good vacuum. Lots of feathers from the feather bed, some random hairs (eek), a few crumbs, and on one bed, a yellowish stain - leaky diaper, I imagine (hope). The feather bed topper and the linens were all crisp and spotless. And I supposed the feather bed was a decent barrier from said stain... Behind the headboard, they could use more attention with the vacuum - lots of dust and feathers back there where the vacuum can't reach. Great choice of carpet color/texture - no visible stains. I know hotel rooms are dirty from use, but it makes me feel better if I can't SEE any actual stains, even if they're there. :) Small room, but I don't do jumping jacks in my hotel room, so it was ok. We even had an umbrella stroller sitting in the room by the window and it was fine. 4 people in the room had plenty of space. Average room size for SF. Bathroom decent size as well. The window seat was comfortable. The cushion had some signs of wear and tear, the walls had some nicks from people being careless with the shutters, but the view was great - what stains? What gouges in the drywall? View made up for it. Comfortable enough to fall asleep on! The closet was fine, kind of tight on space, but doable. I never use the hotel bathrobes, but there were two. Slippers would have been awesome...or even flip flops! How hip would that be, W? Purple flip flops? SUPER cheap way to impress guests. The bathroom - I really like the light blue walls and the glass surface. The toiletries were plentiful and I particularly appreciated the face wash. I often forget mine at home and hotels rarely offer this! The shower/tub combo had the curved curtain which seems to be the standard now. The toilet paper seemed to be awfully far from the toilet, but I'm short and I guess my arms are as well. The roll had the annoying metal flap on it, too. Toilet paper needs a mudguard like a 4x4? I didn't like it. For a double room, I could have used more towels initially (4 of each), however, housekeeping did a very good job. They came while we were out (not too early, not to late) and did a great job refreshing the room. Linens were changed, toiletries were restocked, towels were replaced and everything was dusted and vacuumed. It is always pleasant to come back from a long afternoon to a fresh room. Worth not getting the $5 credit. I also like that if connected rooms are requested, rather than a door in a wall, they have the outer door to connect the rooms. So if you book two rooms together for a family, you almost have a little (dark) foyer. The not-so-perfect: we were located near the stairwell and it got SUPER noisy very late at night. Stairs in a hotel are bad enough, but we're talking about the W and that means herds of girls wearing high heels clomping down metal stairs. As each herd trundled down, it sounded like steel drums...we were watching a movie with the volume pretty high and the noise in the stair well was so loud and startling, it took a moment to register the cause of the noise! The walls are also very thin so it is quite noisy. There were some hooting and hollering guests in the distance. It didn't last particularly long (maybe someone complained) but it was pretty loud and let's face it, it's a hip party hotel for special occasions - parties, etc. We knew this going in, so we were ok with it. However, if you like a nice sleep and are a weary business person or a couple looking for a romantic trip - this might not be the hotel for you. If you are a family and you and the kidlets can't stay up past 8pm, this might not be the hotel for you. Families and peace & quiet seekers, be forewarned. It's like: don't go to Disneyland if you don't like kids. Don't come to the W San Francisco if you're a curmudgeon. So yes, I'd probably stay here again if traveling with my family. Nothing really pulled me in enough to say, "OMG I'll always stay here every time I come to SF," but if the rate is reasonable and it's the best option, I'd do it. There was nothing unpleasant about the stay, it just didn't WoW me. I'd say about average; not the best, not the worst. If I were to travel without kids, as a couple, I wouldn't stay here. I'd pay a bit extra and opt for the St. Regis (around the corner, also a Starwood property) or the Four Seasons to feel really relax and enjoy. And yes, my coffee maker came as requested and promptly. The front desk made sure to follow up just to be sure it arrived on time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tgrame
Reviews.Content: Great location for the Bay to Breakers. We flew into Oakland and took BART into the city. You only need to walk a few blocks to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome gym, people, atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: _swilliams9
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived at the valet, everybody was extremely courteous. When we were checking into our room, they offered all of us something to drink. The elevators were beautiful, silly that I care, but they were awesome! They even had an air diffuser in it, so it smelled amazing. The rooms were beautiful, loved the bathroom which was stocked with your usual hotel shampoo/conditioner/soap, but theirs was the brand offered in their spa which were really nice. Now the gym was incredible. I'm a huge gym fiend, so I had to go even while on vacation. It was open 24/7, convenient since I usually lift late. It had awesome new equipment, and great cardio machines. (I'm not big on cardio, but I just had to use them!) They had a ton of free weights, which helps in catering to everyones specific needs. They had medicine balls, yoga mats, etc. They even set out a fresh tray of apples, new headphones for gym-goers to use, and body cleansing towelettes. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room despite repeated calls for cleaning. Great location but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: montauk1
Reviews.Content: We were using Starwoods points to stay and had to pay with extra points just to get a room. We travel a lot and were very upset not to get an upgraded room even with room availability. We constantly had to ask for extra towels and it was clear that during our 6 day stay that the bathroom was not being cleaned. We had to ask for this to be done but it was still not cleaned properly nor daily as it should have been. They have shag rugs in the bedrooms that just look dirty and unkempt at all times and I did not care for the room furnishings at all. The lighting was poor, the room arrangement was unpleasant and we just did not find this hotel at all up to the normal standards of a W. We just kept complaining and complaining and nothing ever got done. Even when they said that they would notate that two people were staying in the rooms, we would still not find enough towels the next day nor fresh shampoo and all. It was a very unpleasant stay. We would not go back. The only nice thing was the ability to use the Audi car service if it was available - which was not very often, unfortunately. Management did not handle our complaints well enough. The hotel was quiet, but just not clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “I miss staying here so I wanted to go back and write a good review”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Luu
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveller that stays over 200 nights a year in hotels. THE GOOD Great location, great staff, great hotel. W Hotels have a standard that you expect. The W in San Fran meets these standards, and regularly exceeds them. Over the course of the summer of 2010 I stayed regularly at this property. Their rooms were spacious, great views of the city depending on where you stayed. The front desk staff was usually friend and I always seemed to get a upgrade. Food was pretty good (but pricey). Overall the hotel was clean and well run. THE BAD Only complaint would be the staff at the lobby bar. Very unfriendly and would ignore you from time to time. It gets pretty crowded here and can be a scene, but not very good service at all for a lobby bar. THE UGLY You're paying for the W brand and experience... which can be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jackiesyu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because that is what my daughter picked for her birthday -- stay in San Francisco and shopping! She went thru the website and immediately fall in love with this hotel. I booked the room and made a request to have a higher elevation room since she'd love it for her birthday. Check-in at 2pm was a relatively long line and it was at least 10 minutes wait. When I got to the receptionist, I was told that we were already upgraded to a higher elevation room, and get us the key right away. As soon as we got into the room, my daughter was really excited -- the furniture, decor, and overseeing the SF towards the bay bridge. There are a lot of attentions to details that she had told me that she wish she would have a room just like that -- at least she's got it for a day:) By 4pm, a slice of cake is delivered to our room with "happy birthday" on it and it really made her day! All in all, a wonderful place to stay and we all had a great time! Will come again when the lobby is all done with the remodeling...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: canyonmum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quiet, clean, cool decor, no bed bugs. Staff were fantastic, my husband got food poisoning and they gave us a 4pm checkout so he could sleep. The elevators are trippy, there's a 3D flower image that it gives the illusion of putting your hand thru, try it out. Room service prices very steep (no surprises there) but lots of fast food places to eat nearby inc. California Pizza Kitchen, Subway, Quiznos and there's a fantastic deli around the corner (can't remember the name but it's next door to Peets Coffee) where you can get an amazing club sandwich for only $12 and delicious eggs for breakfast. One word of advice, if you are staying here and like to drink alcohol in your room, bring it with you as there is nowhere cheap to buy it, cheapest bottle of wine we found nearby was $25 and it was undrinkable. Also the W Hotel charges $55 per night for parking but you can get it 1-2 blocks away for $30, check Yelp or Google.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: RVARedSoxFan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W San Francisco for a conference. My meetings were literally across the street at Moscone North and it couldn't have been more convenient. Even though the hotel is undergoing some renovation to the common areas and restaurant, the staff didn't miss a beat. The room was lovely and spacious with great views. I used the Acura car service to go to dinner across town and it was wonderful and such a nice perk. The W is a great location, whether you're in SF for business or leisure. I'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a great location with terrible gym”
Reviews.Author: NYLady4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W SF for a conference in May 2011. The rooms, as expected from a W, are very stylish (but also minimalistic so if you are looking for decadent luxury, look elsewhere). The rooms facing the bay have superb views so try to get one if you can. Overall, a very nice W with the usual selection of Bliss toiletries (a huge plus in my opinion) -- but the gym is TERRIBLE so if this factors into your vacation or business plan at all, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jasmine53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at W San Francisco on 22nd floor and really like it. From the room we could see Bay Bridge ( partly ) and the city. The room is clean, modern and the bed is very comfortable. The hotel is in a good location, right next to MOMA and just a few blocks from Union Square. Free coffee, apples and cookies in the lobby is a nice touch. At this time in June they're renovating so the lobby is rather crowded. Parking at the hotel is expensive. We parked our car at Moscone garage nearby. Very convenient and only $27 maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the local for conventions”
Reviews.Author: MissieMom07
Reviews.Content: First imperssion was, "I am not cool enough to stay here", when I checked in on Sunday afternoon. However the crowd changed from mohawks to suits on Monday morning. The room was clean, big, comfy bed, and free Bliss products are the highlights. The gym was great too and the staff was always beyond friendly and helpful. Will stay there again. On the downside it was very expensive in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, slept great and appreciated the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: tstarponce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week for business travel. Hotel staff was friendly and attentive. Location was perfect for my office and meeting facilities. Hotel upgraded me to a great corner room. Beds were comfortable and sheets soft. Loved the room. My colleague was sick when we got there and the staff provided cold medicine for her, they followed this up by sending her a tray of hot tea, fruit and a card that told her they hoped she felt better. That was nice service, we were impressed. Only downside was that the tv/movie function did not work, so there were no movie options. Also the HDTV digital wasn't working well so basic channels did not come in at all. This hotel is being renovated so all food service is in the main lobby, it's quite a scene at night in the bar, so be prepared to navigate the lobby to get to the elevator thru a sea of people. I believe renovation should be complete in the next 3 months. Food choices were very good though. I would stay here again on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Staff are not so good.”
Reviews.Author: TIpperGee13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at W Hotels before and always been very happy. The W San Francisco is perfectly located next to the Museum of Modern Art (MOMA) and opposite Yerba Buena Gardens. A couple of blocks to Union Square. Very easy to navigate around the city. On arrival the staff on reception were a little rude when I asked for a room on a low floor. It all seemed like an inconvenience. We then had to wait as they had no rooms ready. It was 4pm at this point. We were eventually given a corner room. Nice room. In need of an update. Decor seems very late 90s! Small bathroom. Rubbish shower. No pressure at all. Nowhere to put your stuff in the bathroom. Very squashed for two people. The restaurant was being refurbished during our stay so dinner was served in the lobby. Not ideal as the lobby turns in to a bit of a bar/disco in the evening. It is also very windy! You can use the pool/spa area for free. There were kids in there when we went which was not at all relaxing. Try to get a deal on Travelrepublic, Expedia or one of those sites. You get a much better rate. Also, just a note to those thinking of visiting San Francisco. The city seems to have a major problem with homelessness and drug addicts. Living in London this is something we are use to seeing but nowhere near the level that we saw in San Fran. The locals seem to ignore them which was just really sad. They will only bother you for some change...they are not harmful in anyway but may be a shock to some people. Made us really think about the welfare system in the US and why nobody is doing anything about this sad problem.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located city hotel with excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: KushanMitra
Reviews.Content: I had heard a lot about W properties before I went and stayed at the W in San Francisco and I must admit the brand lived up to its promise of being a vibrant brand. One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in a city business hotel. I had a 'Spectacular' room, one up from the standard 'Wonderful' rooms. I like the way the 'W' theme has been kept through the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco. The one bummer is that the hotel pool is a bit small, but then again I didn't really have that much time for a dip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Around!”
Reviews.Author: MktgTraveller
Reviews.Content: Believe me, I know! I have spent as much time on the road as home for a long while now and recently learned that the best way to stay happy on the road is to stay with W! I have been at many of their locations throughout NA, but the SF location is definitely one of the best. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, they really will do whatever, whenever they can to make you happy! Rooms are clean and modern, staff are more than courteous and knowledgeable and overall this is just a wonderfully run, fantastic establishment! Whether for business or pleasure these folks wil works hard to get you to the best places and get you there fast. The doormen and front desk staff deserve special mention as they are truly excetional! I suspect I should also mention it is centrally located steps from Moscone, great shopping and many great restaurants for entertaining clients or vacationers!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, stylish room and great view”
Reviews.Author: hinyan
Reviews.Content: I wanted somewhere stylish, near SFMOMA and Union Square, but not on the hill (stayed at Mark Hopkins before and the hike after a long day can be challenging). So the W it was. And it was a good decision. The check in staff was polite and efficient. We were given a room on the top floor (31st) with great view of Bay Bridge. The room was spacious and stylish. The bathroom was clean and came with Bliss products which was great. When we asked for a kettle, it came with a very nice selection of leaf and herbal teas. Free WiFi was only available in the lobby - which was ok for browsing news and checking personal emails, but when I tried to respond to work related correspondence I found the groovy music and the chatty crowd a bit distracting (personally speaking). While the lobby / lounge was nicely laid out and encouraged guests to sit and socialise, drinks service was surprisingly slow. In fact, it was so slow that a member of staff gave me a free drinks voucher to compensate for my 15 minute wait. On a whole it was a good experience and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: samanthas82
Reviews.Content: That is the one word to describe this stay. I didn't want to go home after my stay at the W in San Francisco. The service was outstanding, food was even better at their XYZ restaurant, and the rooms were spacious and trendy with a welcoming feel.

Reviews.Title: “Every Wish was Granted!”
Reviews.Author: Darlene1224
Reviews.Content: I just attended an Allergy conference in San Fran and stayed at the W. I was a little nervous at first because I brought my 17 month old son and my husband but everything was taken care of by Nina W. She was wonderful. When we got to the room we had a frig, microwave and crib. It was great. We had a beautiful corner room and there was a lot of room for my little one to run around and play. The staff at the W are so nice. When we checked it Nina had a cute gift for the baby. They have hot chocolate in the lobby that is delicious. Everything was perfect and I would highly recommend staying at the W!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and”
Reviews.Author: Mssok
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It's in a great location in the heart of SOMA and the service is perfect from beginning to end. Our room was amazing and with a view of the bay bridge. Extremely friendly front desk staff and breakfast in xyz was delicious. Check out the insider and must have the acura experience. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: LaCasadelCamino
Reviews.Content: Just getting ready to board the plane and I couldn't resist to write about our amazing stay, at the W San Francisco. The room and the service was exceptional, from the front desk at check in to the friendly housekeeping staff, the W Bar servers and the great concierge with awesome recommendations(try out Berreta Pizzeria and the Bourbon and Branch-speakeasy)...The W is very lively, convenient and comfortable. Highlight's, hotel has a cool Asian influenced design, great food at XYZ restaurant, 24/7 fitness center(great variety of equipment, including a speedbag-wow! and complimentary granny smith apples), complimentary "Acura" car service with local drop off(within a 4 mile radius), beats the crazy cabs drivers in in San Fran. Really exceptional experience and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW to the W Hotel. Made my Boyfriends Birthday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PebbleBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation at the W in SF and was very impressed with the layout of the hotel and the amazing views from their rooms!!! WE had a corner WOW room and a view of the Bay Bridge!! The beds were amazing !! They had a nice note wishing my boyfriend a happy birthday along with some very yummy amenities!!! I work at a 5 star hotel on the Monterey Peninsula and I have recommended the W to many guests that are looking for a great experience in the city!! I can't say enough about this GREAT hotel!!! Tell a friend and go experience the W yourself, you won't be dissapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “twas wonderful”
Reviews.Author: frankie57salinas
Reviews.Content: it was an experience like no other. i felt like we were in our own studio apt. with a spectacular view of the bay bridge. i liked the special touches like the sayings on the room number signs and the inside of the elevator decor. the dining room staff were very nice, danielle and nathan as well as abby and how at front desk. the food was exceptional and we would definitely come back for an another experience. thank you w san francisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Clean, Hobby is like a night club!”
Reviews.Author: Kcolette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a long weekend and recommend this hotel. They offer free hot chocolate in the lobby (although about half the time it wasn't available), and games in the lobby and room. The lobby is attached to the restaurant/bar, which is loud and busy during the evenings. Nice if you like a cocktail in the evening and don't mind a DJ. The W is across from the Moscone Center and only a couple blocks down from Market Street. Starbucks is a block away, and if you walk 3-5 blocks you will hit some fast food and restaurants. Room was really nice and clean. Maids came every day and brought new towels.

Reviews.Title: “$3600 Bachelor party authorized $150 unauthorized dog fee NOT in my room!”
Reviews.Author: lampworker13
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my bachelor party at the W. One of my fellow bachelor brought his dog and rented separate rooms and paid a dog fee. The W also chose to charge the fee to my room as well. This was unauthorized by me. Not my dog. It was NOT in my room. I tried three time to contact the management of the "reputable establishment" and explain the obvious confusion. I finally received a return call. (march 9th) The less than eloquent boy from accounting informed me that i would NOT be receiving a refund. American Express will be returning my capital for the unauthorized charge. Don't Leave Home Without It! As for the W my friends and I Will choose to vote With OUR Well and Wonderfully earned dollars elseWhere.... WoW! What unprofessional Weasels. I knoW others of Whom Will be Writing What the knoW as Well. Not a professional decision by the boy in accounting.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a smile”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMarieB
Reviews.Content: I met some girlfriends for breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, and it was delicious!! The mini apple "pop tarts" with the lemon creme sauce are a must, the veggie sausage tasted homemade, and the coffee was fresh. I made a substitution to my scramble without any problems, the staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable. The restaurant is chic, but comfortable and I also recall loving the choice of morning music. I'm excited for our next girl's brunch out!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotrvl99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago and had a really wonderful time. It is close enough to central SF but far enough that you are not stepping on homeless people. We had breakfast one morning and the manager was so nice to come check on us, she was sweet. Front desk was efficient and very calm despite it looking like a busy day. I called down for some qtips and they had them which was so nice, the last hotel I stayed in had none of the items one accidentally forgets. Overall 5 stars, would love to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastEnergy
Reviews.Content: Hotel offered a nice vibe in the midst of San Francisco. Once in the room, it feels much more like a boutique hotel. Comfortable beds, clean rooms and helpful staff. I would stay here again. On our last day, we asked the valet staff to hail us a cab and instead he gave us the hotel's town car to get to work...no charge. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Niggling problems beneath the cool facade”
Reviews.Author: isabella321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February. As we are SPG Gold members, we got upgraded to a Spectacular room with a bay front view. If you can, do request this exact type of room as it affords you a lovely view looking out towards the bay area and the bay bridge. The room itself had the usual cool/fun touches expected in a "W" e.g. iPod docking station, funny notes around the room, good bed, lattice shades for curtains, free taxi service to within a 5mi radius of the hotel, decent bar (XYZ). A few niggles made us decide that we'll not pick "W" for an upcoming SPG stay. Firstly, the double/triple charges for internet is rediculous - at $40 for 3 nights "per device". W, you need to sort out your internet service delivery as your policy does NOT indicate that you will be charged on a per device basis. Guests anyway anticipate they will be charged on a per room basis as is customary at other (non Starwood) hotels so if you want to extract extra revenue from this service, warn guests at checkin. Secondly, there is no coffee maker in the room and you are invited to pick up free coffee at Whatever or order a coffee maker to be delivered to your room. A coffee maker in a room is standard in the US and, although you probably want guests to linger in the lobby and purchase expensive drinks there, its not cool to have to request to have one put in the room......and to wait for 6hrs to actually get it.....and to not have the coffee packs refilled the next day. Thirdly, the cleaning staff were forever opening and closing doors all day along our floor thus disrupting my sleep (I was not on SF time zone as would be most guests). Could you ask them please to wedge the doors open when entering a room to clean it as it was annoying to get some rest anytime between 8am and 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: stipefreak
Reviews.Content: This is a very upscale elegant hotel. Yet I was completely comfortable being casual. MIx of ages. Staff was the BEST. If I had $$$ I would stay there every timeIwent to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and boutique-ish despite it's size”
Reviews.Author: Nique10115
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I think the W group is doing exactly the right thing when it comes to re-thinking the way hotels are designed and presented. The W in SF is extremely stylish - very unique and very different from what you are used to from the large hotel chains which all remsemble themselves so much that it does not really make a difference where you stay. The W has more of a european style, bright pastel colors and lights in the rooms simplicity and yet a lot of nice details like a lit buddha. The have a great bench by the windows with a perfect view of SF. The amendities are samples of the BLISS Spa products and a I only used the face wash (the first time I got that in a hotel) and the liquid sopa but they were great. The lobby is darker, with a turntable for lounge nights and psycadelic wall pictures. Valet parking is available with very nice staff ( they gave us water bottles for the drive home). Pretty pricey with $48 plus tax per night, but parking in SF is always quite a pain. This place probably does not appeal too much conservative travelers who enjoy the dark wood and fabric style, but it is ideal for those who want their eyes spoilt and like something special. A few minor thins that could be improved: We had reserved for two but there was only one bathrobe. Just a detail but one that should be taken care of. Also, our rooms have not been cleaned when we returned around 3:30pm and I called the lobby and asked them to send someone after 8 since we wanted to take a nap. 30mins later we had the roommaid knock on our doors, of course while we were sleeping. Also the mini bar prices are ridiculous. $6 for a small bottle of water and $9 for 8 Oreo Cookies. I cannot say much about whether the room pricing is reasonable because we did not pay the bill, but if your budget isn't tight, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel but why double-charge for Internet?”
Reviews.Author: AJCOxf0rd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with comfortable rooms, lively bar and excellent restaurant. But I was charged twice for in-room Internet access because I used both my laptop and my iPad. it's bad enough being charged at all for a service they provide for free in the lobby but to be double-charged puts the W in 'IFI ' charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel from the Service to the Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ps33110
Reviews.Content: I recommend the W to anyone traveling on business. The XYZ bar is a great place to have afternoon drinks or a cocktail party for customers/clients. We had a reception there during a recent conference and the food and service was amazing. The place was packed but our waiter and busser worked hard to make sure we were all satisfied. If you are lucky enough to be able to book a meeting/event at the W - DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Get Away in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Sisi_83
Reviews.Content: There are absolutely NO words to describe how BEAUTIFUL this hotel is! From when you walk into the lobby you are greeted with professionalism & class! We were offered free hot chocolate and free wi-fi while we waited for our check-in in the sleek lobby. We went on a short sightsee of the hotel and sipped on cocktails at the surprisingly HUGE full bar! There is also a full restaurant to suffice an appitite you may have. When we arrived to the 20th floor of our room the view itself was remarkable!! I recommend getting the city view which is a room in the corner of the hotel where you can view the breathtaking sights of the city with the Bay Bridge as the backdrop! From the flat screen television to the most comfortable bed I've EVER slept on, it's the hotel you HAVE to be in when you come to San Francisco! - Sia D.

Reviews.Title: “Costs a lot more than what it's Worth”
Reviews.Author: clocky
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice in the lobby only. The room was very tiny. You could walk to the main shopping area, busing to the Wharf was the best way , The restraunt in the Hotel were terrible and the service was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular stay!”
Reviews.Author: Albiontravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the W in SF on a fairly regular basis. I LOVE this hotel. From the moment we enter the valet, we feel pampered. It seems that the W, a Starwood property, has thought of everything. Let me count the ways... The valet - though we often drive up in a gigantic Ford F550, dually, dump truck totally covered in mud, the valet is always accommodating -- more than accommodating, actually. Our truck in the W valet is a hilarious sight, and I love that they welcome us so heartily. The front desk - We've stayed at the W at least 10 times over the years. We have only had great experiences checking in and out. One morning we were leaving to catch a flight before anything (Starbucks, Pete's - anything) opened, and the woman that checked us out went out of her way to get my husband coffee and tea for me. What service! The room - We usually stay in a corner suite. I love these rooms. The bathrooms are very well lit -- perfect for putting on makeup (this is something that's often overlooked by other hotels). The products are wonderful, and include not just shampoo and soap, but also wonderful conditioner and the BEST lotion. The bathtub is deep -- perfect for a relaxing soak. I sleep astoundingly well in the W beds. I love that the duvets are crisp and white and the pillows are squishy and down. The W rooms feel clean, fresh and new. This is a small thing, but my husband and I don't have a TV at home, and both of us really enjoy watching HGTV and the Food Network when we go to a hotel. The last three, very wonderful hotels that we've stayed in have not had those channels. The W does. The restaurant - I've mostly eaten breakfast at the W. I've only had good meals there, and I believe everything they serve is organic, which I appreciate. The bar/scene - The W bar scene is hip and fun. If you're up for it, the bar is generally going off most nights. You can hang at the tables in the bar, upstairs or on the couches off to the side. On the weekends they have a DJ, and it gets pretty riotous. Fun! Pets - My husband and I had to pick up our new dog at the SF airport, and stayed at the W that night. A dog bed, organic dog treats and food bowls were waiting for us on our arrival. Finally, the W uses all eco-friendly cleaners and detergents. Another small, but significant detail. Overall, this hotel that caters to business travelers is also fantastic for leisure as well.

Reviews.Title: “A totally unique experience, worth the extra cost!”
Reviews.Author: Rupes44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for my 30th birthday and I have to admit that the hotel contributed to making this an all-around great experience! The first thing I loved was the lobby. Totally retro yet funky-modern decor that spares no expense to impress and into the bar, which really, is the lobby, where we enjoyed being able to sit and have drinks upon arrival. The atmosphere appeals to the younger professionals, which is just fun and funky, like the hotel itself. The rooms continue with this theme, totally unique decor but with all the luxuries of a 5- star hotel. The beds are outrageously comfortable and the view of downtown San Fran from your room is unmatched. Location was perfect, right in the heart of downtown, within walking distance of many major attractions, shopping, resturaunts and the Pier. The staff were always friendly, welcoming and accomodating. Finally, I enjoyed the extra added touch of having the best-tasting hot chocolate ever, always readily available in the lobby. I was also sold on the fact that they allow pets.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and comfort rolled into one!”
Reviews.Author: babylonblue77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W hotel in San Francisco for three nights and it was such a comfortable stay. I really just enjoyed hanging around the hotel and our room. There was hot chocolate in the lobby, a really cool arcade machine with Miss Pac Man and Galaga to play in the inviting sitting area of the hotel, and hip lounge area by the bar. The rooms looked newly designed, where clean, and very comfortable. I loved all the amenities and all the bliss products left for us to use. We ordered room service twice, and it was great on both occasions. I definitely would stay there again when I visit this great city.

Reviews.Title: “W Ideal for Moscone Center visits”
Reviews.Author: DHK44
Reviews.Content: The W hotel is the closest hotel to the Moscone Center for those heading for conferences at that site. The hotel itself is very well kept up, adjoins such features as the Yerba Buena part, the SF Museum of Modern Art and the Metreon, a theater-shopping center combination. Nordstroms and the BART are nearby, The W is a relatively small place, lacking the shops associated with larger hotels, but it's relatively quiet and has an adjoining restaurant, naturally called the XYZ.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points but not worth the extra money!”
Reviews.Author: CAgolfgirl
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels in SF and I travel here often, so I thought I would try the W. Well, the hotel is cool, and the rooms are decent but I will not select this hotel again. It's just not woth the extra money when you can stay at many similar styled hotels that cost much less in the City. The staff is excellent and I did like that they will deliver a coffee maker to your room and another good thing about the room is a long desk with plenty of plugs. I do wish more hotels would think of female travelers and have more plugs in the restroom. The air in the room never really got very cool. At 4am noisy people in the hallway, cheap small little travel hair dryer (come on). The location is not that great but I did walk about a third of a mile to the nearest Starbucks. The walk was nice but the neighborhood is a little sketchy. A little difficult to find the valet parking and the parking is over $45 a night and the one thing that just got me was a tiny bottle of water in the bathroom that was $6. That is just ridiculous as it was probably around 8ozs. They could make money and charge half that much and not looked so greedy..that just really erked me even though I wouldn't buy it at $3.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luciana-Austin
Reviews.Content: I booked the W San Francisco through Hotwire, so I didn't really know what I was getting and was pleasantly surprised. It's a hip hotel and I was a little hesitant about how our reception with a 3 year old would be, but they were great and accommodated us very well. We were given a spacious bedroom with a king bed first, and requested a roll away bed - staff informed that room couldn't really have a roll away (not sure why, because it was quite big) so they asked if it was OK to change us to a different room with 2 double beds instead. This other room was just as nice as the first one, except it felt a little smaller since there were 2 beds. Love the design/decor and our daughter immediately fell in love with the windowsill seat and had room service breakfast sitting there every morning. The location is very convenient, walking distance to Union Square and great restaurants and shopping. It's right next door to the SFMOMA, Yerba Buena Center and the Convention Center. They have a complimentary car service that will drive you anywhere in a certain mile radius from the hotel but we ended up not using it, public transportation was fine. For one day we went North of the city across the Golden Gate by car, the hotel had a loaner car seat that we used (I was surprised that a hotel not exactly for families would have that). Our daughter also loved the old school arcade at the lobby! I would definitely stay at this hotel again, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever, best tag line ever!”
Reviews.Author: hhamm
Reviews.Content: I arrived on New Years day, to start off 2011 on a positive and upbeat note. I wasn't expecting much (not a big Starwood fan) and frankly I'm not a big fan of the Bay Area, I just wanted some relaxing time in the city with my girlfriend. Room service, in room movies and a lot of sleep. The W changed my entire impression of the city and Starwood Hotels. From the time of arrival and our short 3 nights in the hotel it was nothing short of a perfect stay. Everyone from the doorman, to the room service attendant was courteous, punctual, and went above and beyond the call of duty. The W's tag line, whatever, whenever truly holds true at this hotel. They continually did everything in their power to make me feel like royalty. Maybe they knew ahead of time that I was not a big fan? I don't know what it was but the managerial team should be commended on their leadership. I learned a long time ago that people and customer service are never perfect, but when things go wrong, how does the service provider recover from the mis-hap? That everyone, is a true sign of a good General Manager, Department Manager, and training. On one occasion, I specifically asked for Tabasco with our morning breakfast. The room service attendant came upstairs, politely set the table and as I was signing the check I asked him where the hot sauce was. He immediately apologized, and left to retrieve the sauce. That would have been enough, but upon his return he also brought us a very large bottle of Fiji water. What a great surprise. He must of seen the thirst in our eyes. This small gesture was only the first of many great experiences with the staff. Also take advantage of their free Acura MDX service. They will drive you around the city within, I believe, 10 miles to dinner, lunch or shopping. I cannot stop telling everyone about my great visit to the W, just ask anyone of the staff members and they will give you whatever, whenever.... Trust me whenever in the bay area, that's where I'll be... Great job Starwood...just GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel is a FANTASTIC place to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: GRWTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for New Years Eve 2010/2011, and we loved every moment of it. There was amazing hot cocoa in the lobby for all guests, and the staff was INCREDIBLY helpful and friendly. This hotel is modern yet warm, and I would return here for a fun evening in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “High level service”
Reviews.Author: ahopeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. This was my second visit to The W. The front desk service was superb. The doorperson was very congenial. The front desk clerks had nice big smiles upon greeting. They were cheerful and accomodating (Ashby at the front desk was a super-sweetheart, so be nice to her.) The room was super clean and although they are a bit on the small side, the shutter windows with the ledge is a great place to sit, drink wine with a friend and gaze out the window to watch the sun set and the city lights come up. Very romantic. I asked for extra towels during the evening and housekeeping responded promptly. A special thanks goes out to the manager, Dave, for making some special accomodations for early an check-in. It is rare to find such friendly staff in a Hotel in S.F., believe me. There's a young hip crowd there, so you would expect Attitude, but remarkably all I experienced was complete and total hospitality. Even the bartenders were cool.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy is the best description”
Reviews.Author: gcullen
Reviews.Content: They try really hard to be trendy. If that is what you are into, look no further. The clift is probably the less expensive alternative if the price is to much for you. For business travel I'm always cautious of the w hotels as they can attract a loud late night crowd. Stayed there last night (Thursday) and had no issues. I really enjoyed sitting on the window ledge bench seat and looking out the window. This feature really makes the room feel warm and homely. The window ledge feature was the primary reason for my 5 rating on the room.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel was a FABULOUS place to spend New Year's Eve!”
Reviews.Author: SFchica0816
Reviews.Content: We attended the W Hotel's NYE party and had the best time!! The hotel looked great and the party was fun, fun, fun. We had a large group that we needed to accommodate and the staff at the W was amazing. Danielle was an excellent contact person, she helped rearrange our reservation for us several times and was gracious and extremely helpful.
