She even greeted us at the door and personally escorted us to our table! Our waitress was also attentive, friendly and made us feel very VIP!! The party atmosphere was chic and classy and I would highly recommend XYZ to anyone for New Years or any other event that you are looking to celebrate with a night out. AMAZING.FUN.LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for a Great NYE celebration”
Reviews.Author: duke2001j
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the W for our New Year's Eve celebration, and we had a great time. It had a little something for everyone. Plenty of dancing (if that's your thing), a lounge area where the music was quieter so you could have good conversation (which is more my thing), and several bars located throughout if you just wanted to drink the night away. Or of course you could do all of the above. The staff at the W is normally great, but they were even better this week - maybe everyone was still in the holiday spirit or something, but they were willing to go above and beyond to make our experience great. The only complaint I have is that the lobby ran out of their hot chocolate our last day (which might just be the best HC that I've ever had!) but hey, when its cold outside, and you're at a sold out hotel, demand will rise. Anyway, I'd highly recommend the W if you're planning your NYE celebration for 2012 - you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever whenever culture is a wow”
Reviews.Author: Mike831
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W San Francisco for a little over three months (back and forth for business). Everything is nice and obviously trendy as it is the W, but what makes the hotel exceptional is the people. The front desk quickly learned my name and I enjoyed being greeted with a "welcome home mr. ---". A few specific call outs and thank you's Hao and Cora - Always looked forward to getting welcomed on Monday evening Everett, Paul, and Marcus - Thanks for the tips on going out in the city, the whatever whenver service, and always being quick to help me with anything I needed even the difficult task of finding a cab who will take credit card to go short distances Stacey - Thanks a ton for the great restaraunt recomendations, finally tried the Mac n' Cheese at Wayfare tavern and it was very tasty, and extra thanks for the special service when I got I'll - Nothing makes you feel better then some chicken noodle soup. Will and Jaimie at whatever whenever - Sorry for all the calls, but thanks for the great service! Pognon Magalie - Never met, but great talking to you and thanks for understanding Nina - Thanks for my first upgrade, definately one of the reasons I kept coming back in the beginning Michael (something) - You booked me my first room and pulled some strings to get the corporate rate even though it was last minute and not supposed to be available, kept me there for a few more months...good move and thank you Georgie Faine - Thanks for setting up all our rooms and securing the special project rate - greatly appreciated and I will let you know where I will be next. A quick suggestion for travelers, explore the hotel, they have an extra bar upstairs and some cool amenities I didn't realize were there until recently.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: scrambie10
Reviews.Content: We traveled in San Francisco for a wedding in October. It was our first time visiting. We had such a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. They always provided us with suggestions for restaurants and things to do. The hotel was located next to the Museum of Modern Art. There were many places around the W to eat. I really enjoyed dinner at The Thirsty Bear which is located directly across the street from the hotel. We were also across the street from the Buena Vista Gardens. The rooms were really cool, stylish, and comfortable. The provided us with the best bath products I have used at a hotel (from the Bliss Spa). The body lotion was fantastic. The conceriege called us once a day to make sure we had everything we needed. One morning we had an issue with our safe. We called the help desk and they sent someone up within five minutes. I would definately stay at the W Hotel again. We had such a comfortable stay and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5 in SFO - Great location”
Reviews.Author: zhivago22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice with great decor and very vibrant (not stuffy). Service was excellent. Room was very nice, and clean and is better than the pictures provided. Best part of the stay was the complementary Acura shuttle to areas in SFO and the free Pacman arcade game in the lobby. Fitness centre was large. Pool was a bit ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent hotel and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mikemcle
Reviews.Content: I went to the W for business. The hotel was great. They went above and beyond to help me host a business event. The management made arrangements to section off a private area in the bar for a small group of business partners with only one days notice while there was a major cenvetion going on in town. Everyone in town was booked but they made special arrangements to accomidate my needs.

Reviews.Title: “The staff don't care, and for the $$$ you can get better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: I normally like W hotels, having stayed at W's in San Diego, New York and New Orleans but didn't feel the W San Francisco was worth the money. We'd been travelling around California and this was the last hotel we stayed at before flying home. I paid nearly $400 a night for a 3 night stay in a 'Fabulous' corner room, and I felt a bit ripped off. The hotel markets itself as a boutique type hotel with a cool vibe, but to us it came across as snobby and unwelcoming. We're a professional couple in our 30's and we love to travel, which I would think is the target market for the W and we've stayed at several before, so it's not like we just 'don't get it', but we feel that at the end of the day the W staff are in the hospitality industry and the coolest thing they can do is to look after their guests well and at this W they really don't. Pros: 1. The porters were great and out of all the staff these guys were really helpful, and the only ones who seemed to care about the guest experience. 2. The location is great for SFMOMA and Market St/Union Sq restaurants, bars, sightseeing, and shopping. Cons: 1. The front desk staff were really snooty, uninterested and unhelpful. 2. The hotel charges premium prices for *everything* on top of the already fairly high room rates. 3. The 'fabulous' room is just OK. OK view, OK size, adequate sound proofing, decent bed. Hardly 'Fabulous' and personally i found the quirky room decor more than a little garish and tacky. 4. The area seems to be a homeless hot-spot, and there were usually several people begging right outside the hotel every time we went out or came back. It seems the numbers of homeless people increases every time we go back to San Francisco, especially in the Market St/Union Square area, and seeing people who are clearly mentally ill, disabled and/or old living on the streets and rifling through bins is something we can never get used to (Not the W's fault of course, but as it's rife in the area then it'd be remiss not to mention it). 5. The concierge was constantly busy, and when I did wait long enough to get to speak to her it felt like I was an irritating distraction for her. If you want somewhere where the staff care about their guests then stay elsewhere, and if you want a genuinely fashionable boutique hotel then the W isn't it either.

Reviews.Title: “Good for younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: Bulldawg
Reviews.Content: The W was not our first choice and would not be in the future not because of any real problems just not our style. We are both in our 60's and this hotel is more appropriate for the under 35 crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but internet options too expensive”
Reviews.Author: alazydaisy
Reviews.Content: As so many reviews state, this hotel is great in most aspects, although the standard rooms are on the smaller side and we didn't care for the lack of locks on the bathroom. But the internet is too expensive in my opinion and this a deal killer. It's $14.95 PER DEVICE. This means that since my husband and I both have separate computers, we're paying over $30 a day just to access the internet. Not to mention that we both have iphones but can't use the wireless connection because that would be an additional $30 a day. I could live with $15 a day per room, even though that's still kind of high. Charging per device is practically unconscionable. Yes, I could go downstairs and browse the internet free in the lobby but that seems kind of ridiculous since I'm paying for the room, not to hang out in the lobby. Next time I'll find a hotel that charges a fairer rate, or better yet, offers free internet as a courtesy to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “XYZ one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: SuzyZsf
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at XYZ is amazing. The food is very good, but it's the staff that makes the experience special. Everyone, from the hostess to the bus boys, goes the extra mile. Always cheerful and efficient, they start your day off with a smile. The chef is always willing to modify any dish on the menu to suit your needs, and unlike many hotels the prices are very reasonable. Favorite server - Damien - has personality plus. Easy metered street parking in front a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent high end hotel in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: NWTraveler25
Reviews.Content: The W has always been my favorite brand within the Starwood family of hotels. Redeemed my 1 free night here as part of a SPG promotion and it was well worth it! Also stayed at the Westin St Francis the next night and the difference is like night and day. The W is very swanky, but still maintains a high quality feel. The rooms were a fairly good size, the bathrooms were nice, and the Bliss products are a great bonus. Cons: Parking is extremely high ($50/night), but that's the going rate for all hotels in the city. I didn't see a self-park lot, so I had to valet, which took relatively long to retrieve my car. The ambiance is a bit stuffy, but I think that's true with all W hotels. The staff can have a bit of arrogance, which is why I rated it a 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “Events at W San Francisco Exceed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: a_todd_sf
Reviews.Content: W San Francisco has annually helped our organization throw events ranging in size from 30 - 300 guests. The level of detail and service consistently exceeds our expectations. The quality of their cuisine along with the experiences I've had at W is at a level I rarely encounter at hotels...and consistently makes me want to return as a casual customer, in addition to returning as a client.

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun place -- everything makes you smile.”
Reviews.Author: hinda3
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend there -- the W is definitely beautiful, great location, great staff & rooms; but it's also fun. Everything from the Buddha nightlight, the Chinese (W) checkerboard, that little statue to hold your change, and the extra tp roll in a bag that says, "Back-up Plan." Lots of hotels are comfortable and tasteful like this, but here you wander around the room smiling at the little amusements. It's entertaining and different. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “My first time in a W - very pleased”
Reviews.Author: sander9t
Reviews.Content: Before my trip I heard good things and bad things about W Hotels. We stayed at W San Francisco for 3 nights - it was my first time in a W and I was very pleased. First of all, I am very picky regarding cleanness and I was totally satisfied by the room and bathroom's cleanness. The room is on the small side, but we did not have many belongings so that was OK. They do have some interesting decor such as the illuminating Buddha on the shelf. Generally the room looks modern and easy on eyes. The window seat is very cool - My son was 7 months at that time and he liked sitting there watching out of the window for the city view. The bed is comfortable too. The lobby and elevator room are very hip. The location is hard to beat. The biggest downfall is the $48 valet parking fee - your only option at the hotel. However, I did a little research beforehand and used the parking garage across the street for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wheeliegirl84
Reviews.Content: The W was the perfect hotel to host a group of my colleagues while we were in San Francisco for a tradeshow. It was within short walking distance to Market Street, the Moscone Center, the streetcar system, many restaurants within different price ranges and a mall. The decor at the W was incredible - they really focus on the details. There was incense and music playing in the elevators, great views from the rooms, have complimentary rides with their Acura program and the staff is eager to help with anything! I absolutely recommend staying here if you are traveling to San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the W standard”
Reviews.Author: JM7654
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the W San Francisco and had a great experience. The staff was excellent - the concierge provided us with great information about the area, room service was quick and efficient (even at 3 am) and the servers in the restaurant were friendly and knowledgable. They really excelled at delivering the "whatever, whenever" standard. The rooms are eclectic and modern - as to be expected at a W - the lobby lounge is a great place to relax, the upstairs bar is very hip and the food at XYZ was AMAZING. After trying it the first night, we did not even bother to go anywhere else. The location of the hotel was great as well - very easy to get around and close to everything we wanted to do. I've stayed at many W properties throughout the country and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “modern, hip, central location”
Reviews.Author: chemteacherohio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for the Nike Women's Marathon and could not have been happier. The hotel was close to the start line (Union station), shopping, great restraurants, and even the Market Ferry Plaza (defintely recommond checking out the farmers market on Saturdays).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DotA2010
Reviews.Content: The W hotel was very nice hotel and was centrally located in SF. The staff was great and very attentive. Only bad thing was parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever use credit card to make a reservation with W”
Reviews.Author: Travellllller_10
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the hotel and tried to check in, I actually didn't like the hotel and I told them I will let you know in a couple of hours if I will check in or not and they said, sure no problem. Actually I showed my Canadian credit card by mistake and they swiped it but I asked them to cancel the swiping it because it is a Canadian dollar credit card I will never use it for this trip and I gave you wrong card. Anyway I changed my mind and called W hotel and cancelled the reservation. And two weeks after when I checked my credit card statement, I just was SO shocked to see the hotel charged me US$530.21. I didn't like hostile attitude of the doorman and the receptionist was so unkind when I told her I am not sure if it is the right hotel to check in. But I wouldn't mind it because I still could cancel the reservation and get away from all these uncomfortable things but I don't know what to say about the wrong charge of $530.21. It's simply helpless, absurd.

Reviews.Title: “not up to the standards I expect of a W”
Reviews.Author: srpaz
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, but lots of little things added up to annoyance for me. These may be small items, but my expectations are high and these small items should not occur at a W property. 1. Check in. The person assigning me my room made it a point to let me know I she gave me an upgrade. I asked her what that was…she said she put me on a higher floor. Well, for one, I am a Starwood member and am automatically placed on a higher floor and second my co worker who is not a member was put on this same floor just as a matter of assigning her room. Just put me in a room, but don’t tell me I am getting some kind of special upgrade when really, I am not. 2. Bath amenities. My co worker received makeup removal cloths each day, I never received any. If I have a sink and a bath, I appreciate 2 bars of soap so I am not moving them back and forth. To only get 1 bar, and then the next day not be given another for the tub is not appropriate. Additionally, on one of the days when my room was made up, they did not give me any washcloths! None. Now yes I can call housekeeping, but at 6 am I should not have to wait to get in the shower, potentially causing me to be late to my meeting, in order to wait for housekeeping to bring me washcloths and then provide a tip as well. 3. Desk outlets. The outlets on the right side of the desk were dead. When charging laptops, cell phones, etc. it was inconvenient to only have the 2 outlets on the left side of the desk working. 4. Bed, sitting on the edge of the bed the mattress coils stuck out, and the mattress was definitely compressed on the side nearest the window . I would say if the mattress is that old, it should be replaced. 5. Coffee… boy. On the morning of the no washcloth situation (already in a bad mood) I went downstairs to get a cup of coffee.. .this is about 6:30 am. The coffee had been set in the lounge area the previous 2 days. I went there only to see no coffee, so I trek to the check in area, a gentleman there is draining the very last of the coffee there….arrgh. I really need some coffee. Finally find someone only to learn that the coffee is now kept around the corner in the dining room, its only in the bar on busy mornings. I suspect if you are not going to offer in room coffee you can at least make it clear to guests where they can find some without searching for 10 minutes or changing the coffee location based on criteria that I am not privy to. 6. I am supposed to get the paper at my door each morning. Did not, so spoke to the front desk and that was rectified. But I was told on check in that I would be getting the paper, I shouldn’t have had to ask a second time. I will say the Acura car is nice to have, and that worked out well for us. Like I said, these are pretty minor inconveniences – but when staying at a Westin or W property I don’t expect to have to deal with these issues.

Reviews.Title: “When trying to be cool is uncool”
Reviews.Author: tippd
Reviews.Content: This W hotel is fairly average overall. It does have some good points, namely it's location and room cleanliness. It is within walking distance to union square and right next to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. The main negatives of this hotel are the room size (small! And we had a "cool corner room") and the surly reception staff. The front office manager has a lot of work to do to sort out the attitudes of his/her team. The dj in the foyer becomes tiresome after a few days and the restaurant "XYZ" is a bit hit and miss. The food quality was fine, not much variety though and the staff were either very average or very exceptional. W SF would be better off trying to be less cool and working on basic quality hotel service that you get in so many Starwood properties. Overall they need to lift their game!

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive Service, Rude General Manager, Avoid this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hatari10
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be one of my favorite destinations in SF. It has fallen considerably from it's former glory. For example, no doorman when I arrived, no one to help with my bags, the front desk did not have my confirmed reservation correct (wrong room type), and terrible front desk clerk - who was dismissive and rude. When I spoke to the general manager, he refused to be of assistance, other than to apologize that my reservation had been confirmed "by mistake". I've been a big fan of 'W's", but this stay has left me very disappointed. I would highly recommend staying somewhere else in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Hip, Trendy and Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: GreenApple07
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a W Hotel so we didn't know what to expect but after our stay at the W Hotel in San Francisco, this is one of our top picks when choosing a hotel in a big city. For starters, the hotel staff go out of their way to be hospitable, kind and friendly. Even before we arrived, we got a complimentary upgrade and when we arrived, we received a complimentary package of goodies that included chocolates, a personalized welcome card and a "Spin the Bottle" game to play which I thought was quite cute. After we checked into our room, we received a plate of chocolates, biscuits and caramel popcorn. The room itself is very chic and trendy. We had a corner room and it was super quiet! The bed and pillows were both surprisingly super comfortable. Now here are the negatives: - Valet parking is $48.00 plus taxes per night. We did find another parking lot closeby that was charging $20 per night but with no in-and-out privileges. - No free wi-fi in the rooms. There is free wi-fi in the lobby area. - The location was a bit far from the main shopping area. If you are a serious shopper, consider the Westin St. Francis which is located directly in the Union Square. - You need to make an appointment with Bliss Spa in order to use the spa facilities (i.e. sauna).

Reviews.Title: “"Whenever, whatever" is W's saying, and that is absolutely how they go out of their way to accomodate you.”
Reviews.Author: Jenann05
Reviews.Content: The W is a wonderful place to stay. The hotel is beautiful, and the ambience is very relaxing and calming. The rooms are very clean and beds are comfortable. The only thing that might wake you up at night is the fire station located next door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ange1827
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W San Francisco on a Sat night on a sold out night/weekend. Yet, we received the same amount of care, attentiveness and service that we've experienced when we were one of few hotels guests. We were put into an incredibly large, beautiful suite on a very high floor with the most amazing views of the SF skyline! The hotel' bar was hot and hopping, the hotel's location was perfectly central, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. It was a PERFECT night in the most beautiful, romantic city in the U.S.!!! We HIGHLY recommend it! Angela Landgraf

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - like falling asleep in an IKEA”
Reviews.Author: LouisLeCochon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W for a few days during our honeymoon. Good clean hotel, helpful staff, and a good value. Good location in financial district. Only complaint is that the business center charged too much by the minute for internet access. And, the room decor is a bit too IKEA inspired, but that's juts my taste,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CliffTO
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews re hotels but this one deserved it. Having heard beforehand and perhaps expecting a bit less than a regular W hotel, I was very suprised and pleased. The room was small, but just the right size for me - large windows, with a great view and plenty of sunlight. Ipod dock with an incredible sound system! Great, spacious bathroom with a fantastic showerhead. The service was amazing - I forgot my toothbrush and had one delivered within 15 mins at no charge. Everyone was curteous and friendly, superior to almost every other hotel I have stayed in. The food was very expensive but worth not leaving the room for dinner after a tiring day walking around the city. Very big tv screen. The room decorations were a bit hokey but kinda nice :). Location was great. All in all, a great experience. One more thing, it was impossible to find a cab anywhere in SF when I was there - the bellboy spent a good 10 mins trying to hail one down for me. Kudos! Congrats to everyone associated with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay overall....”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great condition and had many wonderful room qualities that exude some character from the region. Valet was quick and effient if not relatively expensive. Check-in was great and offered my kids crayons and coloring book, brought milk and cookies up to the room late at night. Upgraded slightly as platinum to cool corner room after paying 13500pts. Overall, location was right in the heart of downtown and a couple blocks from most transportation options.

Reviews.Title: “OK if using points; but bad value for cash”
Reviews.Author: EricN99
Reviews.Content: Like most W hotels, the overal quality is good and the bar scene is excellent. But the amenities are below what you should expect of a luxury hotel. The bedding was of just OK quality, and less good than many Westin's. The location is fine, but not unique. There are many hotels a few blocks closer to the action. The service at the concierge desk was particularly weak and unattentive. And the rooms are small. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice hotel. We used points and were perfectly happy. But if you're paying $400/night and are used to the best, you'll end up a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Fantastic Suite is FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: ohjenxo
Reviews.Content: I booked this suite for my sweet 16 and it was amazing! The website doesn't really have any pictures of the room so we went and looked at it and it's super cool! [I'll try to attach some pictures] The two bathrooms were so nice, being that we were all girls and took a long time to get ready. It only has one king bed, but there are high benches along basically half of the room that fit 3 of my guests and there is a couch too. The bed was super comfy and the view from our room was amazing! Its kind of expensive but it is amazing. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Wicked!”
Reviews.Author: JTorres80
Reviews.Content: During my recent stay at the W Hotel in San Francisco, which also happend to be my birthday weekend, I must say, we had a fabulously Wicked Weekend. The room was great, the bed was comfy, the staff were cool and the piece of Birthday Cake in my room when we got back from seeing the final showing of Wicked...Was Way Wonderful!!! What a cool hotel. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: NiallJohnston
Reviews.Content: Hello I stayed at the W hotel San Francisco on Sat 18th September.  The hotel is very nice, although the bathroom door in our room did not close fully which was an inconvenience and would stop me staying again as it looked like a design issue rather than a fault in our room. Also the road in front of the hotel was closed off for oracle world, we stood waiting for 10mins for a taxi to pier 39 fisher mans wharf.  The valet said the hotel driver would take us instead, it was 5pm, so we very happily accepted as we didn't have much time.  I was very surprised to be charged 30$ by the hotel driver for this journey.  The return journey back to the hotel was less than 10$.  For these reasons I will stay elsewhere when I return to San Francisco. 53$ per night valet parking is also very expensive. Also be aware that the hotel reception area turns into a nightclub at the weekend evenings, the staff seem more interested to keep the nightclub guests happy than accommodate the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Where else?”
Reviews.Author: nickiemac
Reviews.Content: The W combines a trendy yet very comfortable and relaxed vibe with great staff who can't do enough for you. The General Manager himself makes sure that his guests are welcome and happy. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: rosanne0406
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of experiencing this wonderful hotel last weekend. The food was amazing, the Talent was very welcoming, the beds were so comfortable and the ambiance was very inviting. I would definitely recommend EVERYONE visiting W San Francisco soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: PASTIZZI
Reviews.Content: W Hotel is the place to stay in San Francisco -- rooms are comfortable, bar is great for evenings in and restaurant serves lovely food. The shopping centre is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel so popping in and out is perfect. Kids loved it -- we loved it -- well done W and management -- will certainly revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NelCalifornai
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our kids, ages 6-13 to San Francisco for Labor Day Weekend. We had 2 rooms next to each other. The rooms were very nicely decorated and comfortable. The people staying there were young and trendy. The location was good. 5 min walk to Union Square, 2 min walk to Market St. and a 20 minute walk to North Beach, a definite must for Italian food lovers. The service was OK; I expected more. We asked for a coffee maker and it took them 40 minutes. The concierge wasn't very knowledgeable or helpful in terms of where to go and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a Girl's Night Out!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle0223
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my sister's birthday at W San Francisco, and had a FABULOUS time! The staff (especially the GM of the hotel) were so friendly and courteous. They were very attentive to us, which was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful room and staff, excellent dinning and bar. The best.”
Reviews.Author: MaltaEurope084
Reviews.Content: This is truly a stylish hotel to be enjoyed by all ages from young to not so young. The atmosphere in the lobby bar in the evenings was a great place to have pre dinner or post dinner drinks, meet friends etc. The feed in the restaurant was excellent and catered for all palates and so did the wines available. The spa was an additional plus for us to enjoy after spending a day out shopping or sightseeing. Well done to all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Comfortable, Buzzy hotel”
Reviews.Author: aganado
Reviews.Content: Located 5mins walk away from Market Street and the main shopping area of SF. And very close to chinatown and the financial district - perfect to combine work and pelasure. Already familiar with the W concept, we certainly were not let down by the W in SF. The relaxed feel of the W is immediate, yet all staff maintained an efficient and professional level throughout our 4-day stay. Rooms are great, comfortable, quiet and fun, with the W extras that remove the anonimity of most hotel rooms. Used the fitness centre, indoor pool and jacuzzi (24-hr) - useful when awake at 4am due to jet-lag. The lobby and bar area was always a abuzz, and had a club-like feel later on in the night. We enjoyed the tasting menu at XYZ restaurant - outstanding food and great value for money. Only negative - service a bit slow for breakfast, even though food was worth waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “Entire experience at W was far above our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: winnettvineyards
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the W Hotel in San Francisco in celebration of my birthday. From the moment we arrived in front of the Hotel and were greeted warmly and professionally by the Bellman to our departure the next afternoon, our entire experience at the W went far beyond our expectations. Our room was beautifully appointed, the view of the city breathtaking, room service friendly and top-notch, concierge extremely helpful, and Guest Services staff patient, professional, and very gracious. We believe that General Manager, Michael Pace, deserves to be very proud of the W, his staff, and himself for leading such a great team!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky...”
Reviews.Author: MrWiz1
Reviews.Content: Being an SPG member, booked the W on a recommendation from a local colleague in SF. Modern & swanky bar, youthful & trendy look which is a great social meeting place. Typical "W" theme of modern & trendy, not necessarily a family hotel apart from the pool & the Pac Man machine(free). Good location, 5 mins from union square , on the tourist bus routes with restaurants & bars nearby...ask for an upgrade, it paid off for me..

Reviews.Title: “This is a trendy hotel that definitley...”
Reviews.Author: JACKIEOCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is a trendy hotel that definitley makes you pay for the"cool" aspect of being here. I have never stayed at a W hotel, but i doubt i will be paying this much again for a W hotel. I felt that the rooms were dusty, the windows of the room had greasy finger prints all over them and the dust behind the furniture looked like it had been collecting for quite some time. The room was decorated very cute and i did like that about the W. I also enjoyed the complimentary soaps and shampoos from Bliss... that was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: westin_calgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in a very private ceremony here at the end of July. Everything was amazing. The guest room was spacious, the bed was comfortable and the property was immaculate. Our Wedding Planner Allison Fox was so wonderful, she even stayed late on a Friday night to assist us. The pool area is nice and the gym is a good size for a hotel gym. The restaurant XYZ serves up very good food. The beet salad is delicious. All in all there are no complaints about this hotel, it is n a great location and it is beautiful. Next time we are in San Francisco we won’t think of going anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “They wrote the book on customer service!”
Reviews.Author: BusyMoma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a boutique, one block away from the Moscone Convention Center. My sister was there on business and I tagged along for the fun - after all, this is San Francisco! The hotel staff was welcoming, friendly, and extremely accomodating from start to finish. I'd describe it as casual/chic. Really comfortable seating in the "Living Room", good DJ on the weekends in the bar area, good food, great mixed cocktails. Used the Acura Experience to get to some of the local attractions. Had the same driver 3 times - Phil - and he was a fountain of knowledge and gave us lots of tips about places to eat, things to see, etc. Front desk staff so nice - the names that stand out in my mind are Sophia and Ceasar, but really everyone was very nice, always had a welcoming smile. The doorman Dustin was really great - we had a problem with one of the tour operators that we booked through the hotel - he had the concierge follow-up and sent us a "little something" to the room with a very nice note. (He did this all of his own accord, and followed up with us the next time he saw us.) The hotel had little touches which meant a lot - like complementary coffee in the am, water or light lemonade in the afternoon/evenings, apples everywhere for you to munch on, and biscotti in the morning and cookies in the evening. Sometimes there was fresh fruit or nuts. The rooms were nice, small but expected for a city hotel. Loved the bathroom, lots of light, liked the cube seating and the amenities were really excellent. The room, as I said, was very small but the view made up for it - we were room 2307, had a great view of the Bay Bridge. If I had to pick one negative, it would be the lighting in the room - it was very poor. I am a reader, love to read at night for 20 minutes or so before I go to bed and with every light on in the room, it was pretty dim. But I guess those rooms are not made for the studious reader sort, given the chic reputation of the hotel. Used the gym, thought about using the pool but didn't (it was a very cold 5 days, highs were in the 50s so I didn't feel like swimming.) Gym was more than adequate for my needs, used it 3 times. Almost used the spa but they didn't have availability when I wanted it - and I asked at the last minute so that was my fault. However, it looked nice and smelled wonderful. Oh that is another thing, the smell in the hotel was great! They had fragrance sticks in the elevators but it wasn't overpowering, just added to the overall atmosphere. I know I've said a lot about the hotel but I wanted to give you the impression it made on me. When I return to SF with my husband next spring, we'll be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stoi1
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in San Francisco last week with my family. If you like a club scene atmosphere this hotel is for you. My kids and wife loved it. Great location to Market street and Union square without the crazy crowds. Museums are all around. Rooms are very modern and comfortable. Did not try the restaurant, there were too many interesting places to eat all around. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, a bit well worn, all whims delivered”
Reviews.Author: mamabeargrrr
Reviews.Content: "W" in SF is cool. It is practical, modern, playful and easy living. We had a "Fantastic Corner King" room at first and it was trendy/modern although a little shy on comfortable furniture except for the bed which was great. Later we upgraded to a "Fantastic Suite" on the 28th floor which for only $50 more had two full bathrooms, a large living room, two closets, 2 tvs, 2 stereos, hallways, dressing area and with awesome window benches up high around the corner windows. Having coffee perched up on the window seats taking in the city view was wonderful. The hotel service is great with the "Whatever Whenever" button on the phone. The room service food is good. The spa service and products were good but the facilities need upgrading for more comfort. The hotel in general needs sprucing up as it looks well worn and you have to like the hip white, turquoise, cloud shaped cutout mirrors, built in desks and corner benches, paper lantern sconces--it's a new 70s-like decor. I did not like the sliding glass bathroom doors--not enough privacy and they make so much noise rattling open and closed. The last morning there was hammering above as the WOW Suites above are being remodeled. I complained and my room rate was generously reduced and sincere apologies were made. The bar "living room" is hopping on the weekends with DJs and interesting drinks. "W" is a "green hotel" and is located literally next door to MOMA, across the street from Moscone Center, Yerba Buena Gardens, Bloomingdales and the Metreon. It is walking distance to Union Square and great shopping. It's a fun style hotel for a parent with a teenager. You half expect to see a rock star walk in the front revolving door.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Hip or Cool”
Reviews.Author: Elvey
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very 'Hip and cool' which is code for fashionable and interesting. AND if that is all you are interested in, then this is for you. If however you value service, attention to detail and value for money, be aware that the W seems to have avoided these attributes. The hotel is a short walk from market St, a slightly longer 15 minute walk to the bay and in the middle of the financial district. The reception staff were uninterested and ill informed. They failed to answer our questions and when we disputed part of the bill were incapable of making a decision. The bell hop (s) were excellent but alone this does not make for great service. Food in the hotel was good, but expensive as you might expect. The hotel is a triumph of form over substance

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sksanche
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights with my family of 4. Two children ages 4 and 6. Great location, great vibe. Right next to a fire station and it was still pretty quiet. Our room was on the 24th floor. 2416. No complaints. Parking is just about $50 bucks a night. The vibe inside was great. DJ, drinks and food. Our kids loved the free video game in the lobby along with the other games. They do have a indoor pool which looked nice but didn't use. The rooms were nice too. Would definitely go back with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “Diappointing for a W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: This W has a very different vibe... it feels more like business-as-usual hotel. The special feeling that W's normally have is missing. No room service from 1 am - 5 am, not even coffee... Good location in San Francisco. Rooms as nice with a "beachy" feeling but not very big. We will pick a boutique hotel next we go to SF.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: SandyGeroux
Reviews.Content: This hotel s gorgeous, with some reall cool retro- chic design elements - and I love the long, beautiful fireplace in the lobby, with comfy couches and chairs all around. And the service was superb - and very friendly, rather than overly stiff and formal. Katherine at the front desk was great - she called me back within 5 minutes to answer my question of where I could buy one of those fabulously comfy pillows they use on the beds, and even e-mailed me the info for my convenience! Now that's " whatever, whenever" service! Thanks, W, for a fantastic stay, from start to end!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: AdmissionReady
Reviews.Content: When we first stepped into the hotel lobby, we were amazed! This is not your typical hotel lobby. It has comfortable furniture, has free-play games and the staff are great. The elevators up to our rooms are by far the coolest elevators I've ever seen. When we got to the room, we found a room that looked much more interesting than a regular room. They took many steps to make it look cool and hip. For example, there was a fogged-glass desk with other decorations. There was also a cool blue bench by the windows that was also decorated to look hip. The pool and hot tub are great with the ceiling above it being glass, so that you can look up at the hotel. The XYZ restaurant has great food! I would recommend going there for breakfast at least once. When I went there, it was my birthday. They brought up gourmet cake with beautiful presentation to my room. And by gourmet I mean gourmet! All in all, this was an amazing experience and I would absolutely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MelsmomNewJersey
Reviews.Content: The W San Francisco has the following in its favor: 1) great location, very central to Chinatown, excellent shopping, Union Square, Moscone Center, Bay Bridge, SFMOMA; 2) terrific service (the highest compliment I can pay is that its service approaches Ritz-Carlton standards); 3) very good restaurant called XYZ; 4) large sunny rooms (at least ours was); 5) a real buzz with background music that changes depending on the time of day and a gorgeous crowd especially at night. Mostly, it's the service that left the greatest impression. From check-in to the front door greeters to housekeeping, engineering, and valet parking--all greet you with a smile and an offer to help. Even on a deserted mezzanine floor (I was exploring), a maintenance man called out to me, "Good morning, can I help you find anything today?" Twice we had to call engineering (both times for small problems in the bathroom) and both times an engineer was up at our room on the 19th floor within 5 minutes. After four nights at this hotel, we were sad to leave. SUCH a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lower the price or give better service”
Reviews.Author: letsgoc159t3
Reviews.Content: We rented three rooms in the hotel. They couldn't get all three on the same floor how we asked in our reservation. Incredibly small for the price. I went with some friends from out of town and they didn't speak English so now you can imagine all the trips I had to make with each one of them as they discovered daily how their key hotel cards wouldn't work. Yes, DAILY we had to go down stairs to re-program the key or get a new one. Linens were a bit smelly... forgot I was in a hotel and I put the sheets to cover my face and I don't know if it was the chlorine or not well washed sheets that had a bad foot smell penetrated in them. Yes, the parking is ridiculously expensive and it's just too much of a burden when they charge you for parking when you don't even have a car parked in there. But yes, someone told them one of our room numbers and left their car there for us to pay. Another thing they charged was a movie at an hour that we weren't even in our rooms. I don't know how close the restaurant is affiliated to the W... XYZ is the name of the restaurant. Well, they didn't let one of my friends (the early bird) enter the restaurant to start with coffee and wait for the rest of us to get to the restaurant and have a big great breakfast like we did the morning before. They were rude and so my friend was rude and we decided never to step into the restaurant again. Yeah they are smily both in the hotel and restaurant but the smile was not enough for us. The window door in the bathroom... yeah you know your spouse, relative or friend is sitting in the toilet because you can see clear enough through it. On our first night there, the guy at a desk told us the restaurant was still open and so we all went down for a late dinner... but at the restaurant they told us it was closed. 15 steps away and they did not know about their service time schedule. The manager offered no understanding to what I presented to him as a problem. I guess he really doesn't feel like part of the company. Isn't the manager suppose to feel like he's the owner of the place? He didn't really offer another option for our problems. In general, for the price... I will not return to the W in San Francisco. I felt I was in a cheaper hotel. And believe me, I've been treated and felt ten times better in a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous way to celebrate a birthday”
Reviews.Author: scottsaz
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2 night stay earlier this year for a 50th birthday celebration. We booked the Extreme Suite 3101 and had a fabulous view of the City and Bay Bridge. Kristi (executive assistant) was awesome in helping to set up this birthday event. We were kept in constant email / phone contact prior to our check in day. We had arranged for desserts to be delivered to the hotel while our group of 20 were out for dinner and the W had it brought up to the suite, set up and ready upon our return. We had many compliments from our friends about the Suite and the views. This was our second celebration in this Suite and would do it again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: rhoughta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights with my wife. Comfortable and cool spot. The room had great views and this was for sure the most comfortable trip I've ever had to San Francisco. A special thanks for the psychedelic elevator with non-stop music.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 days in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rainman014
Reviews.Content: My family and I celebrated my wife's birthday in SF and had an amazing time. We stayed at the W and not only were the hotel and room part of a a great property, the staff, (Darcy, Reception, Florena Concierge, and Paul at the Door) all provided top notch Customer Service. The W is the place to stay for business and/or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it looks”
Reviews.Author: leahbest
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to San Francisco last minute for the 4th of July and thought the W would be a fun place to stay. However, the it turned out to be nothing special. As others have mentioned, NOTHING is free! Parking is ridiculously expensive, but it is San Francisco. But to charge $10 for 15 minutes of internet!! The hotel was also very noisy. We had people in the hall until 3am and then the room next to us started showering at 6am! The rooms are kind of fun, but definitly done on the cheap. I think this hotel will go out of style quickly. Next time we go to San Francisco, we'll stay somewhere more comfortable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: LAIrisha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in June and had a wonderful time. The hotel was beautiful, location is fantastic and all the staff was extremely nice and accommodating. The front desk receptionists remembered our names, which really personalized our stay. We were able to take either their Acura car or their company cars (free, tips only) around town and barely had to pay for taxis. The only thing I didn't like was that their parking is ridiculously expensive (over $50/night!), so we parked our car a block away on 3rd across from the conference center, which was $24/night. Easy fix. I highly recommend this hotel, my husband and I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Memories.....”
Reviews.Author: NeeluBagga
Reviews.Content: The staff is so helpful the concierge Florina arranged all Fedex arrivals in time of I wo uld my flight. The security helped me un pack a giant box of basket ball thing any re packed n 3 boxes which I could easily carry as check inn baggage and they have routed my post to my home. I would like to thank Florina, Delna, Saleh, Josh, Roberto , kristi and each one of the crew at the W. guys you were AWSOME....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean and modern room”
Reviews.Author: salfen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the San Francisco leg of our road trip honeymoon. From the airport the hotel was a short 10min walk from the BART station. On arrival we were allocated a corner room which had a lovely seating area, was very clean with lovely Bliss bathroom products. On the weekend there was a DJ in the foyer and a trend crowd around the bar. We ate in the XYZ restaurant, the prices were similar to other high-end restaurants in the city but the food was absoultely fantastic...the best meal we had on the whole 2wk trip! The location was perfect a short walk to Union Sq and a 20min walk to Fisherman's whalf. The only downside was the fire station next door to the hotel - even though we were on the 23rd floor the fire engines leaving with their sirens on in the middle of the night woke us up every night. Even with this we still couldn't have picked a better hotel for our stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome W!”
Reviews.Author: rchandler240
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favoriate W Hotels! Its always awsome with great views and exceptional rooms! Staff very friendly and the living room is always a hot spot to hang out. Within walking distance to almost anywhere in San Fran and also only 2 blocks from the BART train which links to the airport and lots of other places. Historic Trolly stop only 2 blocks also which you can take all the way down the bay/wharf/alcatraz boats, very fun ride!

Reviews.Title: “So you think you are the customer.....”
Reviews.Author: danshedd
Reviews.Content: Flew into SF from NYC and arrived at 3PM - 5 people in line for check in - 1 staff on reception desk - took forever - got to the head of the line only to find that room was not made up! That's right, it is now 3:30 in the afternoon and the room is not ready - go to bar and wait for them to call me on my cell to tell me it is ready. Order drink ($12) and some "spiced nuts" ($6.00) - no complimentary bar junk (nuts, etc.). 30 minutes later phone rings and room is ready - register, get key and return to finish drink. Waitress comes over "can you pay your tab now as my shift is ending"..... Help me here: can't the W management figure out a way to manage the tip tail on their own? The hotel is in a great location but it is not inexpensive and has a "reputation" as a place to go but if you are looking for service and a hotel with its collective act together this isn't it. Totally mismanaged and reminded me of a night in a Queens NYC Motel 8.

Reviews.Title: “Was a little nervous of the Ikea-like rooms in the photos, but we really enjoyed the W!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa567
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a business/pleasure trip. The location is really ideal for conferences at the Moscone Center, but also for people in-town just for sight seeing. We were able to walk to the BART ($8.10 and 30 minutes to get to the hotel from the airport on it), cable cars, buses, etc and also used the free Acura car service for a ride to brunch in the Mission. People said the area shuts down on weekends, but we found MANY places open to eat/drink at over the weekend within a few minutes walk.....and you MUST check out Samovar, a great place to eat, have tea, and relax at across the street at Yerba Buena Gardens. I'm in love....such a great little spot. We had a corner king room on the 16th floor. The views are OK, not breath-taking. The room was a comfortable size and the furniture was not nearly as IKEA-like and cheap looking as the photos make it look. The little "window seats" were great for relaxing and reading on. The bathroom is nothing special and personally, the shower could use some more pressure, but the Bliss products were a nice treat. My 1st day, the hot water went out, but it was fixed very quickly. There's not really a dresser to put away clothing in either, but there are some window ledges that can work as shelves. Our room was full of natural light which we loved (although the shutters didn't really seal the light out if you want to sleep in either) The gym is small, but very clean and modern. It's attached to a small pool/spa which is indoors, but has tons of natural light. We relaxed down there a few times. The spa jets were not working one day, but they quickly fixed it. Had a oxygen facial with Kim in the spa and it was divine. My skin looked fab!! The spa is really not a place to hang out at, but the treatments are good & they give you little snacks which is a nice touch. Room service was prompt, but the food was nothing to write home about (except the plate of cookies....those were GOOD). We spent a lot of time meeting with clients in the hotel lobby bar which always seems to be hopping. A nice, mixed crowd, but an overall very trendy and cool vibe. A nice place to hang out and free wifi in the lobby is an added bonus. Drinks are pricey, but tasty. I wasn't all that impressed with the bartenders....they seemed a bit spacey and not on top of their game (which they should be for $12+ cocktails darn it). Service was good and staff are friendly & polite. They have a little computer in the lobby to print airline boarding passes from and also let us have a 4pm check-out without any cost which was GREATLY appreciated. Overall, we enjoyed our stay & would stay again. Although the place is not 5 star luxury, it has many pluses and the hip and trendy vibe worked well for us (early 30s professional couple).

Reviews.Title: “Lots to love at the W”
Reviews.Author: LasMuchachas
Reviews.Content: We were allowed to check in at 11 am without hesitation and then we learned that they have an "Acura Concierge" where they can drive you to a nearby location. We were definately impressed with this level of customer service. The rooms are cool and hip with an east-west flair, liked the uniqueness. The rooms have great, big flat screen tv's and some cool amenities. We also had treatments here at the Bliss Spa. The treatments/massages were slightly more expensive than what we typically pay but were thoroughly relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't stay again...”
Reviews.Author: tokiboom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the city view corner room over the weekend of June 7th. The hotel was nice enough, the decor was asian inspired with touches of bright colors (white, bright blue). Pros: -Location--We were close to Union Square (we rented a car anyway) -Bliss products!! -Attentive service--we were offered bottled water when retrieving our car from the valet Cons: -Bed was too soft. We are used to a firmer mattress at home so we didn't get restful sleep. -Loud--We stayed on the 7th floor and we could hear the pounding music coming from downstairs. I didn't mind since I sleep with ear plugs anyway. -Next door to a fire station--Literally, the fire station was the building over so it was very loud whenever the fire engines went screaming by. -The air conditioning in the room never got cold even though we set the thermostat to 65. The weather in SF was very warm during the weekend and I was unable to get the room cool enough. -The valet is super expensive (although 48 plus tax and hotel charges is pretty much the standard in the city) Overall, the stay was enjoyable. However, we would probably not stay here again due to the bed--my husband was too uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like the most important guest in the world”
Reviews.Author: dms59
Reviews.Content: In short, they live up to their Whatever/Whenever guarantee. The room was available early, and it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Room service was impeccable; the guy even left a business card so we could call when we put the roll-in table into the hall. Breakfast was delivered perfectly on time. Even though each order has a service charge, they didn't charge that for late-night cookies and milk, saying that dessert shouldn't be a separate meal. Nice touch. Robe was gloriously comfortable. When we left the hotel, the car was brought around perfectly, and the valet even brought a bottle of water for each of us for the road. What a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean rooms, centrally located for Business and Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: RocknRoni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel because my husband was attending a conference at the Moscone Center and we tagged along for a vacation. It was a great location for attending the conference nice and quick to get back in between seminars. We booked the Cool Corner Room on special it was buy 2 nights and get the third night free. The room was very spacious and we were able to divide in half and put the crib on one side so baby had privacy to sleep. The room is filled with many extras, iPod hookup, Chinese checkers, wine and beer fridge, huge bathroom and had interesting odds and ends on the shelves (Buddha & Kaleidoscope). Our stay happened to be at the same time the pride parade was going on so the hotel was pretty busy but staff and concierge always had time to chat with us. The indoor pool and hot tub were very basic and was mostly used by families with children. We did take advantage of the “Acura Experience” and got dropped off at one of the outlet malls. It was great to get a free ride out (we did tip the man) but had to use public transit on the way home. The lobby was very lively at night. I assume people use the lobby/bar as a meeting spot before they go out or a night cap. We didn’t use the restaurant that much as it’s pretty pricey but the few meals we did have were fantastic. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if you were staying on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Upbeat, fun with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Gratitude2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the W for a romantic get away. The lobby was vibrant, and the bar was really fun and busy. Our room was very clean with amazing views of the city. We loved the location as it was close to shopping, the Embarcadero and public transportation. The Bliss Spa is also fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “this place is close enough to perfect for me..”
Reviews.Author: willienelsonthedog
Reviews.Content: they sent a town car to pick us up from the airport. they made dinner reservations for me more than once. they drove us to a restaurant that was on ocean beach (far away). they bought me movie tickets and dropped them off at my room so i could surprise my wife. here is a list of the things you could see from my window: bloomindales. the museum of modern art (!), whole foods (!) the bay bridge, the new baseball stadium, the moscone center, some other museum, a cathedral, and about 4 of the neighborhoods we wanted to visit. you'd have to be pretty cynical to dislike this place. i've visited san francisco many times, and i bet i'll try to stay there the next several times i visit. it was really cool. no kidding. everything you could wanna do is in walking distance. except some of the far away tourist attractions that were a $5 cab ride away. stuff like that... it was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste”
Reviews.Author: trippin7
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is a tired, tired property. The lobby is full of purple, curvy "hip" couches that are stained from the hipsters "petting" them, not to mention the holes in them with stuffing coming out. Rooms are no better than a Holiday Inn Express, but with chartreuse accents and a couple of Budha statues stashed about. Although a devoted Starwood patron, we had never stayed in a W before. The only reason we stayed int he W was because the St. Regis was fully booked. I do not know if all the W Hotels are like this. But I would definitely avoid the San Francisco W. Was "price" the saving grace? "Heck No." Room, room service (a dessert that was simply, bad) and parking puts you at about $500/night. Waaayyyy better alternatives....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent teamwork and service”
Reviews.Author: ygluck
Reviews.Content: Describe the service you experienced Tell us how you liked the room Talk about the location & amenities Say what you liked best & least Service was great. If I needed anything I just asked. The team went out of their way to make sure all details were met and it was as stress free as possible for me. They even printed an emergency set of business cards for our CEO!!! the room was spacious and well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stew14
Reviews.Content: Nice play to stay and the beds were great! The staff was was very friendly and attentive. It has a very nice amibience and the lobby bar is very lively at night. The free car service was a definete plus!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: mrb4mtm
Reviews.Content: Very fine hotel in the heart of the action! Staff is pleasant and very attentive. Rooms are great and quiet. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Summer041
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, Modern and Comfortable setting. Intimate feel, beautful public sitting areas. The service was way above my expectations. I would definately recommend this hotel. Very convenient location as well. Close to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “I was WOWed - Incredible Service - Amazing People and Property”
Reviews.Author: luvnorcal
Reviews.Content: I recently used the W to host 50 of my colleagues and 50 of our customers. The experience was tremendous from beginning to end. The level of detail and the quality of people working at this property is like non I have ever encountered. We had our CEO in the hotel for 3 weeks and he was gushing about the level of service. He felt like part of the family when he checked out! We had also had a party for 400 people in the restaurant and bar and it was one of our most successful events ever...great food, drinks and plenty of networking. I would highly recommend this property to people traveling for business or pleasure. Quite simply the location, service and people cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated 2 year anniversary-exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: atomgirl7
Reviews.Content: Redeemed our Starpoints for a stay at the W to celebrate our 2 year anniversary. When I made the reservation by phone to Starwood, I was informed that my redemption made me eligible for a room with 2 beds, and that we would be staying on one of the lower floors. I asked to note a request for one King bed instead, and that we were staying for our anniversary. Upon arriving late Friday night (around 10:30pm), we walked into the hotel to find a DJ spinning at a turntable in the lounge area, with young professionals having drinks and mingling. At the check-in desk, Abbey was a breathe of fresh air with her upbeat and pleasant attitude. She warmly welcomed us and let us know that our room had a King bed and that we would be staying on the 23rd floor with a city view! Woo hoo! There was a welcome plate of dessert and a nice card thanking us for celebrating our anniversary with them. The workout and pool area is indoor, clean, and has a comfortable ambiance. Wet towelettes, fresh green apples, and disposable earphones are offered in the gym. We checked out early the next morning, so didn't get to explore the hotel too much. But I can say that it's an excellent location, right next door to SFMOMA, within comfortable walking distance to some great restaurants (i.e. Roy's), and a few blocks from Market Street, where it was easy to catch the Muni #5 line down to the Ferry Building (Pier 1). W also has a partnership with Acura, who offers a free drop-off (no pick-up) within x mile radius (I think it's 3) from the hotel for staying guests. It's a chance for them to show off their new cars (MDX), and for you to get a free ride somewhere fast! Great Wherever/Whenever Concierge service-knowledgeable, and great service all around! Staff are friendly, rooms are clean and comfy, and the location is in a great place. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss The W San Fran Experience”
Reviews.Author: kamline
Reviews.Content: If you want to be "WOW'd", STAY HERE. I was in town on biz and it almost felt like all pleasure and fun with the care and prompt service from check in to check out at the San Fran W. No request is taking lightly and you'll have your own fine story, I am certain, of how well your stay went from A to Z. Enjoy, don't miss out.

Reviews.Title: “HORRENDOUS service but nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nc450
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this property. I've stayed at plenty of other W's and they all "wow'ed" me. The actual hotel is in great shape, clean, centrally located, and has a pretty good restaurant (xyz). However, I would never set foot into this establishment again or recommend that anyone stay there. The caliber of some of the staff at this property is terrible. Upon checking in, the front desk attendant seemed robotic, asking me the same questions multiple times and rarely made eye contact. I'm an SPG platinum member and usually get a couple bottles of water in my room, so I asked how it works there and she laughed and said I'd have to pay 11 bucks per bottle here. Fair enough, but don't laugh at a relatively simple question and make me feel like a freeloader! I then asked which direction my room would be facing and she said that she didn't really know, but all the bay bridge rooms were spoken for. My final question (I don't know why I continued to ask questions to this unhelpful person) was regarding where the nearest convenience store is....she pointed me in the direction of the concierge. I got to my nice corner room which was great. Later in the night I came back from a client dinner and needed to sleep but found that my neighbors were having a party. I called "whenever/whatever" (operator) and was transferred to voicemail after voicemail. Finally, frustrated, I went to the front desk where there was only one guy who was flirting with another (attractive) female guest, clearly not discussing anything regarding hotel business. After they finished a couple minutes, he strolled over to where I was standing. I later found out that this was Alex, the "manager on duty." He said that since the hotel didn't have any rooms comparable to mine to move me to and that the only ones are on a low floor with 2 twin beds or handicap rooms. Yet, again, another employee with non-genuine automatic responses. I could tell he was phrasing his responses in a way to get me back up to my room so he could move on to someone else. His solution: a drink coupon. I'm trying to go to bed, not go mingle with all the hookers in the bar (yes, there's quite a few of them). In the morning, my wake-up call never came either. Bottom line, nice building but the staff members could care less about your well-being.

Reviews.Title: “Made my 40th birthday very special!”
Reviews.Author: Baij_Patel
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in downtown San Fran made our stay a very enjoyable one from start to finish! On check-in my wife told them it was my 40th birthday and secured a free upgrade to a corner suite. The check-in took a little while but my 3 year old and I amused ourselves by playing on the retro table-top arcade game in the chill-out lobby area (which she then wanted to play on every time we walked past it!) The room was modern and funky and had great little touches like a Buddha light which our daughter loved. We had a great view from the windows which wrapped around two walls of our room. We also received a lovely birthday note from reception along with a box of Ghiradelli chocolates which was another great touch! We made good use of the Accura car service they had - a couple of plush Accura cars were available for free short trips to town you just had to watch a promo video while in the car which only lasted a few minutes. We didnt eat breakfast here as there is a Starbucks opposite and a nice breakfast place around the corner too. The lobby bar gets busy in the evening as visitors to the local convention centre pile in here but its not too disruptive. We both made use of the Bliss Spa - there triple oxygenating facial is well worth it and the therapist was very friendly. Bliss products in the bathroom are a welcome feature. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and we will be staying here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Trying hard, mixed results”
Reviews.Author: dougjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights May 2010. Rooms are TINY - and I mean like London-sized tiny. I had forgotten this when I booked, and stupidly thought that a "Spectacular" room (that's how they label it) would be, well, not tiny...I was wrong. Still, room was generally clean, if slightly worn. The whole W thing is feeling a bit dated...the goofy sayings and the randomness of it all...but there is some level of quality behind all of it. The hostess at the front desk was excellent and friendly, and the concierge seemed knowledgeable enough. The pool was tired and dirty as well. Two big warning signs: They charge $48 (yes, $48) to park your car overnight. By my estimates, my car bill was almost as great as my hotel bill for the weekend. That's just obnoxious. Also, they will nickel and dime you for everything additional - so while the room rates are reasonable, you have to be very on-guard to avoid extra charges. This interview sounds more negative than I meant it - the W is still a nice place to stay. Location is good (though not as good as Hotel Vitale up the street, which is also 2x/price), service is generally on target and it's a pleasant, if not, amazing, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, Friendly and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: drakeharrison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for four days and was very impressed by the customer service. Each and every interaction that I had with your staff was positive. All the individuals with whom I dealt with at your front desk were professional, pleasant and helpful. The young doorman (I believe he was from Tahoe) impressed me a great deal by calling me by my name two days after I’d initially met him. What a memory! He was very outgoing and pleasant. The two concierge personnel were fabulous. One of them was named Chris. He recommended some marvellous restaurants. The food was delicious (great Mexican Restaurant not too far from your hotel). Unfortunately I can’t recall the name of the young lady who assisted my travelling companion and I on two occasions by getting us 4 tickets to Wicked. Our seats for the amazing performance were perfect. Both individuals were most competent. One day we took the complimentary taxi down to Fishermen’s Warf and the driver was very courteous. What a nice service for the hotel to offer! My travelling companion borrowed one of your bikes so she could cycle across the Golden Gate Bridge, into Sausalito and back to the hotel. The individual who assisted her was helpful and also impressed that she cycled the entire distance. I had a coffee pot delivered to the room and later some coffee and both of the delivery personnel were friendly. When I ran into the housekeeping personnel on two occasions, I was greeted with a smile and hello. The room was clean, nicely decorated and a good size. I particularly liked the seating area and little table as it was cozy and comfortable. The gym offered decent equipment and I like the fact that there were earphones for the tread mill. It was nice having a spa at the hotel which offered nice services although a little costly. The location of the hotel was excellent as it was close to the conference centre, to Fisherman's Warf, shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: Adgeman
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a great four day stay at the W and had a real good time. The service was fantastic from the point when we booked the room. I initially emailed to get some information about the room and then proceeded to have an email conversation over the next two months when their staff were happy to answer questions about local sports bars, tickets to Wicked and restaurant reviews. Joey should be commended as probably the most helpful person I've ever dealt with at a hotel. In terms of the hotel it's in a great location right in the heart of downtown. We didn't try the cafe and restaurant and the bar was too busy at the weekend to try but this wasn't a big deal as there were plenty of places nearby. A great hotel and one I'm sure we'll revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Welcoming With great service, class and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mcbette
Reviews.Content: Right from the beginning the service was outstanding and personal. The decor is warm and cozy, fun and artsy. The location is very good with the hotel across the street from the conference center, next door to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, a walk away from Union Square and Chinatown and close to all transportation. The room was decorated with elegance and comfort. The coffee machine provided came complete with high-end coffee. The concierge desk was like having a personal travel consultant with great tips and helpful directions. All in all, it was a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “always again”
Reviews.Author: Sven242
Reviews.Content: Ok I have to admit that I am adicted to the W bed. A good night sleep is always something I just adore. I booked a corner room and I was WOWed. A cosy sitting area, daylight in the spacious bath, beautifull room lay out, a location to die for. What else do you want when travelling to get a break from your all day life?

Reviews.Title: “Hip - Sophisticated - Fun, Fun, Fun!”
Reviews.Author: REITgurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W San Francisco to celebrate my friend's birthday. The staff was amazing - friendly, helpful and they even had a special surprise waiting for my friend in the room when we checked in - they made her celebratory weekend extra special. The bar/club in the hotel was fantastic - we loved the scene, which had a good mix of people and good music. Best of all, the hotel staff remembered us a hotel guests, so we received a little extra special attention, which was nice. Best of all, once we retreated to our room for the night, you could never tell that there was a party going on in the hotel - it was the perfect venue to play and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, lobby is active but room was very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tomot
Reviews.Content: I usually shy away from W hotels - it has always seemed to me that the W hotels try to cultivate a hip vibe which always makes me worry that it will be too loud for me to have a quiet night's rest. Although the lobby was abuzz with activity, our room was VERY quiet. It was a nice size room and nicely designed --- a very comfortable place to stay. I will definitely come back here for either business or pleasure. Btw, last time I was in SF I stayed at another more budget oriented hotel --- it was about half the price of the W (see my previous SF review from February 2010, if interested). I would still recommend the other hotel for those who are traveling on a budget, I preferred the W.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sfdann
Reviews.Content: There is no question the W San Francisco is a hot spot. The XYZ bar is a scene and it can be shocking to learn that even as a hotel guest, you cannot just walk into your own lobby bar (by showing your room key) but have to stand in a line with everyone who isn't staying there. But that is the price of being in a place everyone wants to be. The great news is that once you are there, the staff really finds a way to care and deliver quality. I was extremely impressed with the personal effort being expended by so many of the team members at this property. The rooms were very comfortable (some with great views) and I had a really memorable stay - the phrase 'whenever, wherever' is true. They make it happen here - no matter what you need - even at 3 in the morning. Amazing food quality at room service. And fast. Wow. This is all about staff effort. On the negative side (nothing to do with the SF property) I don't like the W policy about charging an arm and a leg for internet service in the business center. This is just too greedy and reminds me that I'm in a major city where a company is out to make a buck - and it is a jarring jolt from the oasis that is the rest of the W experience. I would stay here again without a doubt. A big high five to the staff of the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very nice hotel, great service, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MerTexas
Reviews.Content: We went here for my husbands birthday, it was a very nice experience. The staff were great we forgot some stuff and they got it for us in just 5 minutes. Trendy hotel, nice bar, great location! You sleep great and the food in the Restaurant is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, W stands above all others”
Reviews.Author: SBTraveling13
Reviews.Content: Please don't be surprised to hear that I had an amazing time staying at the San Francisco W. This was my 3rd trip in March / April and I chose to go back to W for all three of these stays. Services were all unique and W branded and I did enjoy utilizing the Acura Transportation Services at this location. Staff were very well aware of the type of service required for them to offer each guest and in my opinion, they went above and beyond the call of duty to out-perform one another for the best service offered. :-)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location when attending the Moscone Center”
Reviews.Author: Marylandtraveller07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and it was a great location, literally across the street from the convention center. A 25 minute walk to the wharf and close to Union Square. The staff was friendly and helpful. I loved my room! My only complaint is it is next to a fire station (the side my room was on) so there are times you hear sirens. Free coffee every morning at the XYZ restaurant was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Treat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sechda
Reviews.Content: We've traveled throughout Europe and across the U.S. with our teenage boys -- staying at 5, 4, and 3 star hotels. The W Hotel in S.F. is one of our all time favorites!! It's a GEM! ...great location...wonderful staff...fantastic restaurant...spectacular rooms!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: erosales534
